steps.instruction: Start by coloring the tile in the sixth column, fifth from the top red.
Create a less-than sign (<) using the original tile as the left-most point and coloring three more tiles red for each the top and bottom parts of the less-than sign.
Add two more red tiles to connect the ends of the less-than sign. The result will be a red triangle.
On the eighth row from the left, vertically, and the fifth tile down on that row, leave it blank but fill in all tiles that touch that with red.
Above the rightmost two red tiles, add another red tile touching the top of the top rightmost tile. Add below those three rightmost tiles one additional red tile, making a row of 4 red tiles.
Color in the tile, immediate to the left of the leftmost two tiles, with red, this is the fifth tile from top and sixth from the left.
In the sixth column from the left, paint the fifth tile from the top red
Paint the next three tiles diagonally to the top right red
Paint the next three tiles downward red
Paint the empty tiles in between the last step and the first step to form equal triangular red tiles painting
Paint the fourth through eighth hexagons in column eleven purple.
Paint the sixth hexagon in column seven purple.

Paint the hexagons purple from the sixth hexagon in the seventh row up to the first purple hexagon in the eleventh row as well as down to the last purple hexagon in the eleventh row to make a triangle.
Fill the 8th column from the right with 5 purple hexes, starting with the 4th from the top and ending with 3rd from the bottom.
Fill hexes with purple to create a triangle pointing to the left. The 3 hexes in the middle should stay empty.
With purple, paint the cell at the 7th column from the left and 6th row from top.
With purple, paint the cell at the 11th column from the left and 4th row from top.
With purple, paint the cell at the 11th column from the left and 3rd row from bottom.
Connect the 3 cells with purple to form an open triangle.
on fifth row from top, 9th row from left, color the tile purple.
color all tiles touching the purple tile, green to create a sort of flower.
With purple, paint the cell located at the 9th column from left and 5th row from top.
With green, paint the 6 cells around the purple cell in step 1.
Color the 5th tile from the top of the 9th column from the left PURPLE.
Color all tiles adjacent to this tile GREEN.
With blue, paint the cell at the 4th column from the right at the top row.
With blue, paint the cell at the 4th column from the right and the 4th cell from the top.
With the cells you painted as the top and bottom vertices, paint a 4 sided-shape with each side being 4 cells in length with blue paint.
Color the inside of the 4-sided shape you created with blue paint.
Use blue to fill the 2nd spot of the 12th and last columns.
Fill in the 2nd and 3rd spots on the 13th and 17th columns.
Fill in the top 3 spots on the 14th and 16th columns.
Fill in the top 4 spots on the 15th column.
This will be a blue diamond when done. Starting in the rightmost column, color the 2nd tile from the top blue.
In the second column from the right, color the 2nd and 3rd from the top blue.
In the third column from the right, color the topmost 3 blue.
In the 4th column from the right, color the topmost 4 blue.
In the 5th column from the right, color the topmost 3 blue.
In the 6th column from the right, color the 2nd and 3rd from the top blue.
In the 7th column from the right color the 2nd tile from the top.
Fill all the odd-numbered columns vertically with green.
Starting from the leftmost column, fully color every other column GREEN.
Make 9 columns by coloring every other column green starting with the leftmost column.
Use orange on the top 5 spaces and blue on the bottom 5 spaces of the 1st, 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th columns.
Use blue on the top 5 spaces and orange on the bottom 5 spaces in the 3rd, 7th, 11th, and 15th columns.
In columns # 1, 5, 9, 13, and 17 starting at the top, paint to first 5 tiles down orange, then paint the last 5 tiles below them blue.
In columns # 3, 7, 11, and 15 starting at the top, paint to first 5 tiles down blue, then paint the last 5 tiles below them orange.
in first column on left of grid, start with 5 orange hexagons and complete it with 5 blue hexagons. Leave column 2 from left white.
Repeat these colors and this 5:5 scheme every other column but alternate the two colors so that each colored column is the opposite order of the one on either side of it.
using the second tile down in the second vertical row (from left) leave that tile white but color all tiles around it purple. This forms a purple ring.

leaving a blank row next over to the right, repeat the pattern, making a ring of 6 purple tiles, continue this pattern until you have a total of 4 purple rings spaced, leaving a row of vertical tiles between them.
Make a small purple circle around the 2nd spot in the 2nd column.
Make identical purple circles around the 2nd spot in the 6th, 10th, and 14th columns.
With purple, paint the 6 cells around the cell located at the 2nd column from left and 2nd cell from top to form a ring.
Paint 3 more purple rings to the right of the 1st ring, making sure to leave one empty column between each ring.
Color all tiles orange around eighth vertical row from left, third tile from the top of that row, resulting in an orange circle there.
On 12th vertical row from left, 3rd tile down, color all tiles touching that tile, orange.
On 8th vertical row 7th tile down, color all tiles touching that one orange, leaving it blank (as in other steps).
on 12th row, vertically from left, 7th tile down, color all tiles touching it orange, leaving it blank.
form a blue circle to fit in between the 4 orange circles drawn, of the same number of tiles, same size (six tiles, as in others).
Make a blue flower of six tiles surrounding the fifth tile in the tenth column.
Make four orange flowers connecting to the original on the outermost corners, leaving a white tile between each orange flower.
On the bottom of the board, count over to the 5th cell that extends down from the body.
Skip the first 5 cells in that column and color the 6th cell red.
Create a ring by coloring all cells touching the cell in the previous step blue.
From the bottom and top most cells in the previous step, skip the cell touching the 2 diagonal edges and paint the next cell on the diagonal red.
Repeat step 3 for all four new red cells, but this time use orange.
Uncolor all red cells.
on fifth row down from top, and 10th row from left, leave that tile blank but color all tiles that touch it, red. This forms a red circle.

Repeat this design, but make it in green, use topmost red tile to organize the green circle, the two tiles directly on top of the uppermost red tile form the leftmost wall of the new green six sided flower, alternate this pattern all around the central red.

Place a blue six sided circle that touches both the green and red, to the right of red, continue alternating green again, then blue, forming three total green and three total blue completely surrounding the original red circle with similarly designed circles, all with a white tile in the center.
This will be 7 connected flowers when we are done. In the 8th column from the left, the third tile down is your center. It is blank, and the 6 tiles around it are blue.
In the 8th column from the right, the third tile down is blank and the 6 surrounding tiles will be green.
In the 6th column from the right, the 5th tile down is blank, and the 6 tiles surrounding it will be blue.
In the 7th column from the right, the 4th tile from the bottom is blank, and the 6 tiles surrounding it will be green.
In the 9th column from the left, the third tile from the bottom is blank, and the 6 surrounding tiles will be blue.
In the 7th column from the left the 5th tile from the bottom is blank, and the 6 surrounding tiles are green.
In the 10th column from the left, the 5th tile down is blank, and the 6 surrounding tiles are red.
Starting from the bottom left count over 5 cells that stick down and up 5. Paint this cell purple.
Color all cells touching the purple cell red.
Starting at the topmost edge of the red ring and working clockwise, color the cell adjacent to the top of the ring green and the next one green too.
Color the next 2 cells blue.
Continue working around the red until back to the top.
For every green pair of cells outside the red ring, construct a green ring incorporating both cells around the blank cell touching both of them.
Repeat step 6 for all blue cells.
Uncolor the purple cell.
Fill the top three hexes in the 3rd column from the left with red.
Fill 3 hexes to the left with red to form a triangle pointing left.

Repeat this triangle shape 3 times in red, at the same vertical height but with a empty column between the base of each triangle and the point of the next triangle. The 3 columns on the far right should remain empty.
With red, paint the cell at the 1st column on the left and 2nd row from top.
With red, paint the top 2 cells of the 2nd column from left.
With red, paint the top 3 rows of the 3rd column from the left.
Repeat the triangle pattern 3 more times to the right of the 1st triangle, making sure to leave one empty column between each triangle.
Make a triangle from 9 red tiles, longest side is on the third row from the left, starting at the top downwards, the long side will have 3 tiles.

repeat the red triangle with same orientation starting with one vertical white row between the triangles. Do this to make a total of 4 red triangles. For clarity and reference, the longest rows (3 tiles each) are vertical (from left to right) 3, 7, 11, 15.

1. Create a series of blue triangles with the vertical three tiles starting on uppermost three tiles on leftmost vertical line, each triangle will be made of 6 tiles in decreasing number per row, centrally oriented. Starting on that first row, then fifth vertical row, Ninth vertical row and thirteenth vertical row. you'll have three blue triangles making the top of the grids here.

Starting with leftmost vertical row on fourth, fifth, and sixth tiles from top, create green triangles in the same manner as the blue topmost row was, touching on the lowest blue tile, constructing a three tile line of tiles, descending to two, then one tile, repeating, forming 4 green triangles.
Fill in the tiles that are blank between the green and blue triangles formed previously with red tiles, this will form a line of red, oppositely oriented triangles to fill in the white.

Create another set of blue tiles below the lowermost green tile, coloring in the three tiles in the vertical line from the green above them, in the same manner as step 1, these triangles will start seventh, eighth and Ninth from the top, then one less tile repeating the same number from the left as indicated in step 1. You will have a set of 4 more blue tiles here.

Fill in a triangle between the green and blue triangles, using yellow tiles, making 4 sets of triangles, consisting of six tiles each in the manner of the red tiles above, the longest vertical line here, for reference will be the fifth, sixth, and seventh rows from the top the shorter part of the triangle extends leftwards from that in descending order.
Lastly, form red triangles in the same orientation as step three. filling in spaces left between the bottom and blue tiles, constructing triangles (four) with longest sides on the right.
To double check make sure the right two rows vertically are left uncolored, also, bottom most tiles on vertical rows 1, 2, 5, 6, 9, 10, and 13 and 14 should be blank.
In the leftmost column, color tiles 1-3 from the top and 2-4 from the bottom blue
In the second column from the left, color tiles 1 and 2 at the top blue as well as the 3rd and 4th tiles from the bottom
In the third column from the left, color the 2nd tile from the top and the 3rd tile from the bottom blue
Repeat steps 1-3 starting in columns 5, 9, and 13 from the left using the color blue to create a total of 8 blue arrows
In the leftmost column, color tiles 4-6 from the top green
In the second column from the left, color tiles 4 and 5 from the top green
In the third column from the left, color the 5th tile from the top green
Repeat steps 5-7 starting in columns 5, 9, and 13 with the color green to create a total of 4 green arrows
In the second column from the left, color the 3rd tile from the top and the 2nd tile from the bottom red
In the third column from the left, color the 3rd and 4th tiles from the top red as well as the bottom 2 tiles
In the fourth column from the left, color tiles 2-4 from the top red as well as the bottom 3 tiles
Repeat steps 9-11 starting in columns 6, 10, and 14 to make a total of 8 red arrows pointing to the left
Use the color yellow to fill in the spaces between the red, green, and blue arrows to make a total of 4 yellow arrows seated directly between the red arrows

Paint the first three hexagons in column one blue, the first two hexagons in column two blue, and the second hexagon in column three blue, to make a triangle and then copy this triangle starting in columns five, nine, and thirteen to make a row of blue triangles.
Repeat the pattern to make three more blue triangles, starting with hexagons seven, eight, and nine in column one and the third triangle in the row beginning in column thirteen.
Make another row of three green triangles, starting with hexagons four, five, and six in column one so that the green row of triangles is in the middle of the two blue rows.
In column four, paint the second, third and fourth hexagons red, hexagons five, six, and seven yellow, and hexagons eight, nine, and ten red.
Complete the triangle patterns using column four as the color guide, to complete two more rows of red and one row of yellow in between the green and blue rows.
In the left most column paint the fifth tile from the top purple.
Paint the tile below green.
Paint the tile below orange.
Paint the tile below blue.
Paint the tile below red.
Paint the tile below yellow.
In the next column paint the fifth tile from the top purple.
Paint the tile below green.
Paint the tile below orange.
Paint the tile below blue.
Paint the tile below red.
In the next column paint the sixth tile from the top purple.
Paint the tile below green.
Paint the tile below orange.
Paint the tile below blue.
In the next column paint the sixth tile from the top purple.
Paint the tile below green.
Paint the tile below orange.
In the next column paint the seventh tile from the top purple.
Paint the tile below green.
In the next column paint the seventh tile from the top purple.
Notice the pattern created.
Replicate this pattern in columns 13-18, but mirrored.
There should be two identical patterns on each side of the board.
Make two multicolored triangles starting by making the bottom tile in the first and last column yellow.
Finish the triangles by adding two red tiles above the yellow, then three blue, four orange, five green, and finally six purple.
Starting on the lowest tile on the left most side, color the corner tile yellow.
Diagonally from that bottom yellow tile, color the tile above and the one diagonally downwards from there, red.

color the next tiles blue, continuing to fan outwards from there, adding one tile for each diagonal line, make the next line orange, next line green then lastly purple. The purple line will have 6 tiles.

Do the same pattern on the bottom tile of the RIGHT most vertical row, copying the pattern exactly except orienting the tiles to the right, making a sort of mirror rainbow of tiles there. Number of tiles used is the same.
Paint the second hexagons in columns one, four, seven, ten, thirteen, and sixteen all green.
Paint the second hexagons in columns two, three, five, six, eight, nine, eleven, twelve, fourteen, fifteen, seventeen, and eighteen all blue.
On the leftmost column paint the second tile from the top green.
For the next two columns repeat the same action of painting the second tile from the top blue.
For the next column repeat the same action with green.
For the next two columns repeat the same action with blue.
Repeat the pattern that has been created for the remaining tiles. Every set of three columns should have one green tile and two blue tiles.
You are finished when you have a horizontal line that reaches the rightmost column.
Use 1 green and 2 blues in a pattern to fill in the second spot on each column.
From the left side of the board, color the second cell from the bottom green.

Building off the cell in the previous step, create a wavy line extending to the right by alternating attaching subsequent cells to the bottom right then the top right sides with these colors: red, red, orange, orange, orange.
Color the cell on the upper-right edge of the last cell in the previous step green and repeat step 2.
Repeat step 3.
In columns #1, 7, and 13, paint the tile second from the bottom, green.
In columns #2, 3, 8, 9, 14 and 15, paint the tile second from the bottom, red.
In columns #4, 5, 6, 10, 11, 12, 16, 17 and 18, paint the tile second from the bottom, orange.

Leave the bottom row of the grid blank but the second row, starting on the left side (from bottom) color the first tile green, the next two tiles, red, the third and fourth and fifth tiles should be orange.
Repeat step 1 colors all on second row from bottom all the way to the right of the grid.
In columns #1 through to 9, paint the second, sixth, and tenth tiles down red, then paint the fourth and eigth tiles down green.
In columns #9 through to 18, paint the second, sixth, and tenth tiles down green, then paint the fourth and eigth tiles down red.
In red, color the second hexagon from the top for the first nine columns, from left to right.
Use green for the next nine columns in the same line.
Underneath the red hexagons, skip a hexagon in each column and color the next green, so you have a line of red, a line empty, and a line of green.
Follow the line coloring red underneath the green.
Skip a line and once again color nine red then nine green hexagons in a row.
Repeat for two more rows, alternating red and green halves for each line and column and skipping every other row.
The second row from the top consists of 9 red hexagons on the left and then 9 green hexagons.
After leaving row 3 white, in row 4 switch the colors and make the opposite design.
Repeat this pattern until you run out of room on grid.
Make a multicolored caterpillar by coloring the second tile of each column in sets of three going from left to right and following the pattern: orange, green, purple.
Make four more caterpillars below the first leaving an empty space between each but shifting the color pattern to the right (the next caterpillar will start with purple on the left side).
Use orange to fill the 2nd spots on the 1st three columns.
Skip a space and make this shape with purple below.
Continue skipping rows and making shapes that are green, then orange, and lastly purple.
Use green to fill the 2nd spots on the 4th-6th columns.
Skip a space and make this shape with orange below.
Continue skipping and making shapes with purple, and green, and finally orange.
Repeat the shape from steps 1-3, starting with the color purple, then green then orange, then purple, etc.
Alternate these shape patterns with the same color patterns starting each of the next sets with orange, then green, then purple.
With orange, paint the 2nd cell from top of the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd column from the left.
With green, paint the 2nd cell from the top of the 4th, 5th, and 6th column from the left.
With purple, paint the 2nd cell from the top of the 7th, 8th, and 9th column from the left.
Repeat steps 1-3 across the grid to the right.
Repeat the pattern created in steps 1-4, staring at the 4th cell from top on the left-most column. The pattern should alternate, starting with purple, then orange, then green.
Repeat the pattern created in 5, staring at the 6th cell from top on the left-most column. The pattern should alternate, starting with green, then purple, then orange.
Repeat the pattern created in the previous step, staring at the 8th cell from top on the left-most column. The pattern should alternate, starting with orange, then green, then purple.
Repeat the pattern created in the previous step, staring at the bottom cell from of the left-most column. The pattern should alternate, starting with purple, then orange, then green.
Use blue to make the first two spots in the 1st, 3rd, 7th, 9th, 13th, and 15th columns.
Fill in the first spots in the 2nd, 8th, and 14th columns.
Use red to fill the first spot of the 4th - 6th, 10th - 12th, and 16th - 18th columns.
fill in the second spots on the 5th, 11th, and 17th columns.
In columns one, three, seven, nine, thirteen and fifteen, paint the first two tiles blue.
In columns two, eight, and fourteen, paint the first tile blue.
In columns five , eleven and seventeen, paint the first two tiles red.
In columns four, six, ten, twelve, sixteen, and eighteen, paint the first tile red.
In the leftmost column paint the first two tiles from the top blue.
In the next column paint the top most tile blue.
In the next column paint the first two tiles from the top blue.
In the next column paint the top most tile red.
In the next column paint the first two tiles from the top red.
In the next column paint the top most tile red.
Notice the pattern created from steps 1-6, repeat this pattern and stop and the rightmost column.
There should be three blue patterns, and three red patterns alternating between each other.
In the left most column paint the first two tiles from the top red.
Skip one tile below and paint the next two tiles red.
Skip one tile below and paint the next two tiles red.
In the next column paint the top most tile red.
Skip two tiles below and paint the next tile red.
Skip two tiles below and paint the next tile red.
In the next column paint the first two tiles from the top red.
Skip one tile below and paint the next two tiles red.
Skip one tile below and paint the next two tiles red.
In the next column paint the top most tile yellow.
Skip two tiles below and paint the next tile yellow.
Skip two tiles below and paint the next tile yellow.
In the next column paint the first two tiles from the top yellow.
Skip one tile below and paint the next two tiles yellow.
Skip one tile below and paint the next two tiles yellow.
In the next column paint the top most tile yellow.
Skip two tiles below and paint the next tile yellow.
Skip two tiles below and paint the next tile yellow.
There should now be three red patterns and three yellow patterns formed in six columns.
Repeat these patterns using steps 1-18 for the rest of the board until it reaches the right most column.
There should be nine red patterns, and nine yellow patterns once finished.
Use red fill in the 1st, 2nd, 4th, 5th, 7th, and 8th spots on columns 1, 3, 7, 9, 13, and 15.
Fill in the 1st, 4th, and 7th spots on columns 2, 8, and 14.
Change to yellow and fill in the 1st, 4th, and 7th spots on columns 4, 6, 10, 12, 16, and 18.
Fill in the 1st, 2nd, 4th, 5th, 7th, and 8th spots on columns 5, 11, and 17.
In columns # 1, 3, 7, 9, 13, and 15 paint the top 2 tiles down red, skip one tile down, paint the next 2 tiles down red, skip one tile down and paint the next 2 tiles down red.
In columns # 2, 8, and 14 paint the top tile red, then paint the fourth and seventh tiles down red.
In columns # 4, 6, 10, 12, 16 and 18 paint the top tile yellow, then paint the fourth and seventh tiles down yellow.
In columns #5, 11 and 17 paint the top 2 tiles down yellow, skip one tile down, paint the next 2 tiles down yellow, skip one tile down and paint the next 2 tiles down yellow.
In the 2nd column from the left, color the top tile GREEN. Color the four tiles immediately to the left and right of this tile GREEN as well (a "dog bone" shape).
Color the four tiles right below the "dog bone" PURPLE (a "diamond" shape).
Fill in another "dog bone" (BLUE) to the immediate right of the diamond, as well as another "diamond" (ORANGE) right above that.
Copy and shift this four-color shape DOWN (leaving no unfilled tiles in between), inverting the colors between the old and new groupings in the following manner: GREEN <-> ORANGE, BLUE <-> PURPLE.
Repeat step 4 again. Leave bottom row of tiles empty. You should see a "checkerboard" pattern; no shapes which are touching should be the same color.
Take the whole colored pattern you have built; copy and shift it over to the right twice to fill out the board. Preserve the color scheme from the original pattern.
Draw a bow-tie shape in green in the top-left corner- filling the top two hexes in column 1 and 3, and the top hex in column 2.
Draw a UFO shape directly underneath in purple- filling from left to right: 1 hex, 2 hexes, 1 hex
Fill a bow-tie shape directly underneath in orange, followed by a UFO shape in blue, a bow-tie shape in green, and a UFO shape in purple. The bottom three hexes are blank.

In the next three columns, starting again with the top hexes, fill them with: a UFO in orange, a bow-tie in blue, and UFO in green, a bow-tie in purple, a UFO in orange, and a bow-tie in blue. The bottom-most hexes are again left blank.
Repeat this set of shapes (6 columns) two more times, filling the grid apart from the bottom-most row.
In the leftmost column paint the first two tiles at the top green.
Paint the next tile below purple.
Paint the next two tiles below orange.
Paint the next tile below blue.
Paint the next two tiles below green.
Paint the next tile below purple.
In the next column paint the top most tile green.
Paint the next two tiles below purple.
Paint the next tile below orange.
Paint the next two tiles below blue.
Paint the next tile below green.
Paint the next two tiles below purple.
In the next column paint the two tiles at the top green.
Paint the next tile below purple.
Paint the next two tiles below orange.
Paint the next tile below blue.
Paint the next two tiles below green.
Paint the next tile below purple.
In the next column paint the top most tile orange.
Paint the next two tiles below blue.
Paint the next tile below green.
Paint the next two tiles below purple.
Paint the next tile below orange.
Paint the next two tiles below blue.
In the next column paint the first two tiles at the top orange.
Paint the next tile below blue.
Paint the next two tiles below green.
Paint the next tile below purple.
Paint the next two tiles below orange.
Paint the next tile below blue.
In the next column paint the top most tile orange.
Paint the next two tiles below blue.
Paint the next tile below green.
Paint the next two tiles below purple.
Paint the next tile below orange.
Paint the next two tiles below blue.
Notice the patterns created in columns 1-6.
Recreate the sets of patterns for columns 7-18.
Use purple to fill in the last spots on the 1st, 2nd, 4th, 7th, 8th, 10th, 13th, 14th, and 16th columns.
Fill in one spot up from the spots you fill in on columns 4, 10, and 16.
This is a repeating pattern. Start in the first column from the left, the bottom most tile will be purple.
The 2nd column from the left, the bottom most tile will be purple.
The 4th column from the left the bottom 2 tiles will be purple. This is the pattern, repeat it starting in the 7th row from the left.
It will repeat a third time starting in the 6th row from the right.
Paint the last tile in columns one, two, four, seven, eight, ten, thirteen, fourteen, and sixteen  purple.
Paint the second to last tile in columns four, ten, and sixteen purple.
Using green shade the 4th and 10th spots in the 1st, 2nd, 12th, and 13th columns.
Use yellow to shade the 4th and 10th spots in the 4th, 5th, 9th, and 10th columns.
Use green to shade the 7th spots in the 4th, 5th, 9th, and 10th columns.
Use yellow to shade the 7th spots in the 1st, 2nd, 12th, and 13th columns.
Shade the 3rd, 4th, 9th, and 10th spots green, and the 6th and 7th spots yellow in the 7th column.
Shade the 3rd, 4th, 9th, and 10th spots yellow, and the 6th and 7th spots green in the 16th column.
In the 1st column from the left, color the bottom-most tile GREEN. Color the tile down and to the right of this tile GREEN as well.
In the 4th column from the left, color the bottom-most tile YELLOW. Color the tile up and to the right of this tile YELLOW as well.
In the 7th column from the left, color the two bottom-most tiles GREEN.
Take note of the three groups of shapes you've just drawn. This will be our base pattern.

Copy and translate the base pattern UP by three tiles, but invert the colors; the shapes which were green in the old pattern should be yellow in the new pattern, and vice versa. The 4th and 5th tiles from the bottom in the 7th column from the left should be filled in.

Copy and translate this new pattern UP by another three tiles, inverting the color palette again (i.e., should match the first base pattern you drew). The 3rd and 4th tiles from the TOP of the 7th column from the left should be filled in.
Reflect the diagonal shapes in the first 5 columns across horizontally, using the 7th column as the line of symmetry. Note that color patterns should be reflected symmetrically as well.
Copy and translate the vertical groupings of shapes (the 7th column from the left) to the third column from the RIGHT, inverting the colors. These should meet the bottom edge of the grid.
Begin at third column from right side. Starting from bottom, make hexagons 1, 2, 7, and 8 yellow. Make 4 and 5 green.
Keep the colors and spacing the same, but reverse the color scheme in column 7 from the left side.
In bottom left corner color two hexagons green. continue on bottom row to the right and leave next hexagon white, the two after that should be yellow.
Make a mirror image of this scheme on the other side of the two green hexagons at the bottom of column 7 from the left.
Go back to first column on left side. make fourth hexagon from bottom of columns 1 and 2 yellow, then the 4th and 5th hexagons in same row green.
do a mirror image of this scheme on the other side of the two yellow hexagons on the 7th column from the left.
repeat what you did in step three on the fourth row from the top left side with the same mirror image on other side of the two green hexagons in column 7.
Paint the cell located at the 8th column from the left and 4th row from the bottom with blue.
Paint the 3 cells below the blue cell with green.
Paint the cell located at the 1st column on left and the 4th row from top with green.
Paint a straight line between the green cell from step 3 with the blue cell with green paint.
Paint the cell located at the 1st column on right and the 2nd row from top with green.
Paint a straight line between the green cell from step 5 with the blue cell with green paint.
Locate the eighth column from the leftmost side.
Starting from the bottom paint three tiles green in a vertical line.
Paint the next tile above blue.
Draw a green diagonal line that goes from the left of the blue tile to the leftmost column.
Draw a green diagonal line that goes from the right of the blue tile to the rightmost column.
The drawing is complete, check to see if it resembles an asymmetrical Y shape.
On the bottom most row, paint the 8th tile green.
Using the same color paint the next two tiles above it, and finish the vertical column of four tiles with the blue one.
Starting from the blue tile, paint the upper left and the upper right tiles green, and continue with the same pattern to create two diagonals until you reach the end of the grid on both sides.
Begin with the 6th hexagon from the right edge on the top row. Make it blue.  Make the next two hexagons moving down that column red, another blue, and the fifth green.

Start a tangent descending to the right in a straight line from this green hexagon.  make the first hexagon after the green one blue, the next two red, another blue, and the last one in this tangent red (located on the right-most column, the fourth hexagon from the bottom.

Return to the green hexagon. Begin a tangent line from here descending in a straight line. After the green hexagon, color the next one blue, then two red, and continue this color pattern until you run out of room on the grid.
Fill the 5th spot of the 13th column with green.
Make the spot above that blue and the two spots above that red, then the top spot blue.
make the 5th spots of the 12th and 14th columns blue.
Go diagonally down from those in the pattern of two red, one blue.
Color the 5th hex from the top in the 6th column from the right green.
Directly above, and diagonally down to the right and left from this cell color one hex blue each, for three blue hexes.
Extending from these blue hexes draw straight lines to the edge of the board alternating two red hexes with one blue hex. So that the overall pattern is blue-red-red, etc.
Starting with the cell in the upper leftmost corner, create a line of 4 cells extending from the lower right edge orange.
From the last cell in the previous step color the next cell in line yellow.
Building on the cell in step 2 color 4 cells extending from the upper right side of it orange.
Paint 4 cells orange extending straight down from the yellow cell in step 2.
Paint the cell directly below the line created in step 4 black.
From the bottom edge of the cell in step 5 add 2 orange cells directly beneath it.
From the bottom left of the black cell, create a diagonal line going down and to the left of 4 purple cells.
From the black cell, create a line of 6 purple cells extending from the top right of the black cell.
Extend the line in step 8 by adding 1 blue cell.
From the top of the blue cell, color 3 cells purple going straight up.
From the bottom right edge of the blue cell create a line of 6 purple extending down and to the right.
Use purple to fill the top 3 spots of the 12th column.
make the 4th spot blue.
Create a purple diagonal line from the right side of the blue spot to the 7th spot of the 18th column and from the left side to the last spot on the 1st column.
Use yellow to fill the 3rd spot on the 5th column.
Make orange diagonal line from the yellow spot to the first spots on the 1st and 9th column.
Fill in the 4 spots below the yellow spot with orange.
make the next spot black
fill in the last two spots on that column with orange.
In the 5th column from the left, color the 3rd tile down yellow.
In the 5th column from the left, color the third tile from the bottom black.
In the 7th column from the right, color the 4th tile from the top blue.
In the first column from the left start at the top tile and create a straight line in orange tiles to the yellow tile.
In the 9th column from the left, start at the top tile and create a straight line in orange tiles to the yellow tile.
Starting at the black tile, create a straight line of orange tiles to the yellow tile. Leave the black and yellow tiles alone.
Color the 2 tiles underneath the black tile orange.
In the first column from the left, the bottom most tile will be purple. Draw a straight line from here to the blue tile. Leave the black tile black, and leave the blue tile blue.
Color the 3 tiles above the blue tile purple.
In the first column from the right, color the 4th tile from the bottom purple.
Make a straight line of purple tiles to the blue tile from the last tile you colored, leave the blue tile blue.
Fill the 4th spot of the 7th column with orange.
circle around that with red.
Make diagonal lines that alternate red and yellow out from every spot surrounding the orange spot.
Paint the fourth hexagon in the seventh column orange and paint all of the hexagons surrounding it red.
Paint a diagonal line starting with the third hexagon yellow in column nine and alternating between red and yellow to end with a the first hexagon in column thirteen being yellow.
Copy this pattern of alternating between red and yellow, starting with yellow from hexagon five in column nine and ending in the second to last hexagon in the last column.

Copy the same pattern starting with the sixth hexagon in the seventh column, alternating between red and yellow to complete the column, and again starting with both hexagon three and five in column five to make three more diagonal lines.
Paint the first hexagon in the seventh column red and the second hexagon in the same column yellow.

On 7th row from left, fourth tile down, color it orange. Color all tiles surrounding it red. Then emanating outward from those red tiles on from outermost edges of tiles create a starburst style, alternating red and yellow tiles, beginning with yellow that touch the original red rosette in the center. There will be 6 lines going out to the very edge, one from each tile in the original (circle/rosette) design.
Create a purple circle by starting at the 4th spot on the 6th column, and go diagonally down from both sides to the 5th spots on the 4th, and 8th columns.
Go straight down to the 7th spots on those columns, and then back diagonally into the 8th spot on the 6th column.
Make diagonal lines with blue from the 4th and 9th spots in the first column to the purple circle.
Fill the top three and last two spots on the 6th column with blue.
Create blue diagonal lines from the first spot in the 17th column, and the last spot in the 14th column to the purple circle.
Draw a purple hexagonal ring, three spaces to each side, starting in the third space from the bottom of the sixth column, counting from the left, using that space as one of the corners.
Draw a blue spoke radiating outward from each of the corners, going as far as the grid will allow.
Along the top of the board, beginning with the third sunken cell, create a vertical line of blue cells extending to the bottom of the board.
Create a diagonal blue line starting with the cell that is fourth down from the top left corner extending to the lower right.
Skip the cell that is the bottom left corner of the board and create a blue line extending up and to the right from the next cell.
From each of the first cells created in steps 1, 2, and 3, color the 4th and 8th cells in each line purple.
Create a ring of purple cells by adding one purple between each 2 purple cells colored in step 4.
Uncolor any cells within the purple ring.
With blue, paint the 9th column from the left.
With orange, starting with the top row, paint every other cell in the 10th column from the left.
For each of the orange cells from step 2, paint a descending diagonal line to the end of the grid with orange paint.
There is a straight line down the middle. The 9th column from the left the top most tile is blue, the bottom most tile in this column is blue. Connect the 2 tiles with a straight line of blue tiles.
In the first column from the right, the 5th from the top is orange.
In the 9th column from the right, the topmost tile is orange. Connect the last 2 tiles with a straight line of orange tiles.

In the first column from the right, the 4th tile from the bottom is orange. In the 9th column from the right, the 3rd one from the top is orange. Connect these 2 tiles with a straight line of orange tiles.

In the 9th column from the right, the 5th tile from the top is orange. In the first column from the right, the 2nd tile from the bottom is orange. Connect these 2 tiles with a straight line of orange tiles.
In the 9th column from the right, the 7th from the top is orange. In the 3rd column from the right, the bottom most tile is orange. Connect these 2 tiles with a straight line of orange tiles.
In the 9th column from the right, the 2nd from the bottom is orange. In the 7th column from the right, the bottom most tile is orange. Connect these 2 with an orange tile.
Start with blue to fill in the entire 9th column.
Change to orange and fill in every other spot on the 10th column starting at the first spot.
Make diagonal lines down from each spot with orange.
In column #7 starting at topmost tile fill all tiles downward purple.
In column #8, paint topmost tile then third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 9 paint second, fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 10 paint second, fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 11 paint third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 12 paint third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 13 paint fourth, sixth, eight and tenth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 14 paint fourth, sixth, eight and tenth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 15 paint fifth, seventh and ninth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 16 paint fifth, seventh and ninth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 17 paint sixth, eight and tenth tiles from the top blue.
In column # 18 paint sixth, eight and tenth tiles from the top blue.
With purple, paint the 7th column from the left.
With blue, in the 8th column starting at the top row, paint every other cell.
For each of the blue cells from step 2, paint descending diagonal lines to the end of the grid with blue paint.
fill in the 7th column with purple.
Fill every other spot in the 8th column with blue starting at the top.
Make a diagonal line going down from each blue spot.
Paint the 9th column from the left red.
In the column to the right of the red column, paint every other cell with green starting at the top row.
On the column to the right of the green column, paint every other cell with blue starting at the 2nd from the top row.
Continue the descending diagonal lines, alternating between green and blue until you reach the end of each of the 5 diagonal lines.
Paint all tiles in the 9th column from the left red
In the next column, paint the topmost tile green
Paint all tiles, diagonally downward to the right by alternating color blue and green till the last column.
Skip a tile underneath the topmost tile in step 2, start another diagonal painting with green color to the bottom left following the same pattern in step three
Paint the remaining diagonal following the same pattern till you exhaust all tiles downward, always skip a tile
Paint all of the hexagons in the ninth column red.
Paint every other hexagon in the tenth column green, starting with the first hexagon in the column.

Paint every other hexagon in column twelve green, starting with the second hexagon in the column and continue this pattern in columns fourteen, sixteen, and eighteen, starting with the hexagon that is one lower than the column before to make diagonal lines ending in column eighteen.
Paint the hexagon between the green hexagons blue to complete the diagonal lines.
Paint all of the hexagons in column seven green.
Paint every other hexagon in column eight blue, starting with the first.

Continue on to the right, painting every other hexagon in every other column blue but starting one lower than the column before so that column ten starts with hexagon two painted, column twelve starting with hexagon three, and so on, ending with the very last column having hexagons six, eight, and ten painted blue.
With green, paint the 7th column from left.
With blue, starting with the top cell, paint every other cell of the 8th column from left.
With blue, starting with the 2nd cell from top, paint every other cell of the 10th column from left.
With blue, starting with the 3rd cell from top, paint every other cell of the 12th column from left.
With blue, starting with the 4th cell from top, paint every other cell of the 14th column from left.
With blue, starting with the 5th cell from top, paint every other cell of the 16th column from left.
With blue, starting with the 6th cell from top, paint every other cell of the right-most column.
Paint the whole 7th column green.
Now, switch to blue and paint the topmost tile on the 8th column.
While still in the same column, paint every other tile using the same color.
After each blue tile, paint every other one downright till the end.
Color in the seventh vertical row from the left from top to bottom with orange tiles.
color the top tile of the 6th vertical row blue, color the 4th tile from the top on the leftmost vertical column connect those tiles with a diagonal of blue tiles.

skip the next diagonal line below the first line made in step 2, leaving it white. Then color every other diagonal line downwards blue, making a total of 5 diagonals of blue. This is all left of the orange line.
Mirror the blue line or horizontal tiles given on the left with a green 5 lines, horizontally on the right, going all the way to the right side of the grid.
Color all tiles in the 7th column from the left ORANGE.
Starting from the top row of tiles, color every OTHER tile in the 6th column from the left BLUE.
Starting from the top row of tiles, color every OTHER tile in the 8th column from the left GREEN.
In the 5th column from the left, color BLUE all the tiles which border to the left and below of the blue tiles you colored in step 2.
In the 9th column from the left, color GREEN all the tiles which border to the right and below of the green tiles you colored in step 2.

Now extend the diagonal "branches" you began making in the previous four steps out to meet the edge of the board. This should appear as a series of diagonal lines radiating out from the orange column. All colored tiles to the left and right of the orange column should be BLUE and GREEN, respectively.
In column #1 starting from the top, paint the fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down blue
In columns #2 and 3 starting from the top, paint the third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down blue.
In columns #4 and 5 starting from the top, paint the second, fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down blue.
In column #6 paint the topmost tile blue, then paint the third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down blue.
In column # 7, starting from the topmost tile,  paint all tiles down orange.
In column #8 paint the topmost tile green, then paint the third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down green.
In columns #9 and 10 starting from the top, paint the second, fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
In columns #11 and 12 starting from the top, paint the third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down green.
In columns #13 and 14 starting from the top, paint the fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
In columns #15 and 16 starting from the top, paint the fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down green.
In columns #17 and 18 starting from the top, paint the sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
On seventh row from left (vertical row) color all tiles from the topmost to bottom most tile, red.
Color in Green then yellow, repeating the alternating pattern, to the rightmost lower tile. making a diagonal line down to right from the uppermost 8th vertically rowed tile down.
Skip the next row below the line just created in 2, leaving that diagonal row of tiles white.
Repeat the diagonal Green then yellow coloring of tiles used in Step two starting on third row from top on 8th vertical row, copying the pattern and direction of 2.
Continue this alternating row, alternating color pattern until the bottom left part of the area to the right of red line. This will result in coloring 5 lines on the right of the red line.
on 6th row from left, top tile, color the line diagonally to mirror steps 2 through 5. This will fill the left part of the hex cells except the top most left most 9 tiles, which will be blank.
Starting in the bottom hex of the 4th column from the left, fill a line of four hexes in the top-right direction. First hex is green, then yellow, then green, then yellow.
Continue the line in a bottom-right direction back to the bottom of the grid, filling in green, then yellow, then green.
In the first column on the left, fill the lowest hex in yellow, leave the hex above it blank, then fill the next in yellow, repeating the pattern until you have 4 hexes with 1 empty hex between each

Use the 4 hexes in the left-most column as the starting point for lines that mimic the "mountain" shape of the first line. Use alternating yellow and green hexes, with the "peak" of the mountain in the same column as the first, and the left-bottom of the mountain on either the bottom of left edge of the grid. Keep an empty hex between each line.
Fill the 7th column (where the "peaks" of the mountains are) entirely with red, replacing both blank hexes and yellow with red.
Use red to fill in the 7th column.
Use green to fill in every other spot starting at the first spot on each column on the left and right of the red vertical line.
Make diagonal lines that alternate yellow and green down from each of the green dots.
Color yellow all tiles between (and including) 7th tile from left top most to bottom most tile. Form a vertical yellow line here.
Form a diagonal line starting on the top tile, 8th row from left, make the tiles all blue in this line all the way to the right.
color all the tiles in the line from step 2, with blue.
Make a diagonal line starting with third tile down on 6th vertical row, going downwards to the left there, coloring those 6 tiles blue.
Skip three horizontal rows below the blue line formed in step 2, leaving them blank and form a blue horizontal parallel line to that (4th row down from line made in step 2)

Skip three horizontal lines below the line made in step 4, leaving them white, then on fourth line color it blue, forming a second diagonal and parallel line to the left of the yellow line but below the line made in step 4.
Form a short 3 tiled blue line below the line made in step 5. diagonal line of blue tiles, it will be leaving three blank tiles between the new line and the line made in step 5.
Starting with the 4th cell from the left that extends above the body of cells, create a line going straight down to the bottom, colored yellow.
Starting from the lower right of the first cell colored in step 1, create a diagonal blue line extending to the right edge of the board.
Working from the line created in step 2, skip the 3 cells directly below it and repeat step 2.
Working from the line created in step 3, skip the 3 cells directly below it and repeat step 3.
Beginning from the third yellow cell from the top, create a diagonal blue line extending down and to the left to the left edge of the board.
Skip 3 cells down from step 5 and repeat step 5.
Counting from the left, paint the seventh vertical column yellow.

Beginning on the right, alternating left and right, paint the adjacent space between the top pair of yellow spaces blue, then do the same to the left of the next pair of yellow spaces, repeating this pattern downward until there are 5 blue spaces adjacent to the column.
Paint continuous diagonal blue lines, descending from each of the blue spaces, going from the yellow column to the outer edges of the grid.
In the first column from the left, color the bottom most tile red. In the first column from the right, color the top most tile red.
Connect these 2 tiles with a straight line of red tiles.
In the first column from the left starting at the top tile, color a straight line of blue tiles down to the red tile.
Do this for every other column until you have a column with one blue above one red. For example you will do column 1, and skip column 2, then do column 3, and skip column 4.
Make a red line going diagonally across the board starting with the last tile of the first column and ending with the first tile of the last column.
Make vertical blue lines above the red line starting with the first column and filling in every other column to the right.

Paint a blue line in every other column, starting with the first, and painting nine tiles, but after this you're going to take away the very last tile so each line has one less tile than the last. So, column one has nine tiles colored, column three has eight tiles colored, column five has seven tiles colored, and so on until you get to only one tile colored in column seventeen.
Paint from column one tile ten diagonal, upwards, and to the right red, ending all the way on the opposite side with column eighteen, tile one.
Paint a blue line connecting the bottom space of the far left column to the top space of the far right column.

Paint parallel descending diagonal yellow lines to the right of the blue line, leaving one space thickness blank between each of the parallel lines, starting in the adjacent space between the lowest two blue spaces.
Create a blue diagonal line from the last space of the first column to the first space of the last column.
Fill in every other spot along the underside of the line with yellow.
Create diagonal line from the yellow spots to the bottom with yellow.
With blue, paint the bottom cell of the left-most column.
With blue, paint the top cell of the right-most column.
With blue, paint a straight line between the 2 cells from step 1-2.
With yellow, paint the cell directly underneath the right-most blue cell.
Repeat step 4, skipping every other blue cell until you reach the end of the blue line.
To the right of the blue line, for each of the yellow cell from steps 4-5, paint a descending diagonal line to the end of the grid using yellow paint.
Fill in (YELLOW) the top right-most and bottom left-most tiles.
Fill in (YELLOW) the main diagonal between the two tiles from the previous step.
Starting from the leftmost column and moving to the right, fill in (BLUE) the top tile of every OTHER column.
Extend (BLUE) these columns down to meet the yellow diagonal. Do not color outside the boundary set by the diagonal.

Using the yellow diagonal as the line of symmetry, reflect and recolor the blue columns over this line to make a series of GREEN diagonal lines. Extend these lines out to the edge of the board (note that "halves" of the pattern will not be exactly symmetrical due to grid spacing).
You should see an assemblage of "branches" radiating out from the diagonal in a leaf-like pattern.
In column # 1 paint all tiles down to second from the bottom, blue, then paint bottommost tile yellow.
In column # 2 paint the bottommost tile green and second from the bottom yellow.
In column # 3 starting at the top tile, paint 8 tiles down blue, then paint tile below those blue tiles, yellow.
In column # 4, paint the eighth tile down yellow and the ninth tile down green.
In column # 5 starting at the top tile, paint 7 tiles down blue, then paint tile below those blue tiles, yellow and then paint the bottommost tile green.
In column # 6, paint the seventh tile down yellow and the eighth and tenth tile down green.
In column # 7 starting at the top tile, paint 6 tiles down blue, then paint tile below those blue tiles, yellow and then paint the ninth tile down green.
In column # 8, paint the sixth tile down yellow and the seventh and ninth tile down green.
In column # 9 starting at the top tile, paint 5 tiles down blue, then paint tile below those blue tiles, yellow and then paint the eighth and tenth tiles down green.
In column # 10, paint the fifth tile down yellow and the sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
In column # 11 starting at the top tile, paint 4 tiles down blue, then paint tile below those blue tiles, yellow and then paint the seventh and ninth tiles down green.
In column # 12, paint the fourth tile down yellow and the fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down green.
In column # 13 starting at the top tile, paint 3 tiles down blue, then paint tile below those blue tiles, yellow and then paint the sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
In column # 14, paint the third tile down yellow and the fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
In column # 15 paint two topmost tiles down blue, then paint tile below those blue tiles, yellow and then paint the fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down green.
In column # 16, paint the second tile down yellow and the third, fifth, seventh and ninth tiles down green.
In column # 17 paint topmost tile blue, the second tile down yellow and then paint the fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
Finally in column # 18, paint the topmost tile yellow and the second, fourth, sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down green.
Create a yellow diagonal line by filling in the first spot on the last column on your right, down to the last spot on the first column on the left.
Create blue vertical lines on every other column starting at the 1st. Do not go below the yellow line.
Create green diagonal lines under the yellow line by starting on the last column and fill in, skipping every other spot.
Create lines from those spots to the yellow line.
Continue making lines from the yellow line in every other spot along it to the end.
Note: The only color used in this pattern is GREEN.
Find the upper right-most tile. Fill in all tiles adjacent to this tile (3 in all)
Locate the tiles adjacent to the 3 tiles you filled in the previous step. Leave these unfilled, but fill in the next "layer" out (you should fill in 6 tiles in all).
Radiating out from the upper right, extend this pattern of filled and unfilled "layers" to fill the grid.
Fill in every other column with green tiles starting with all tiles in the left column, filling in from the top, and removing one tile from the bottom with each column.
Continue each column by adding green tiles diagonally down and to the right from the last tile in each column and continuing to the edge of the board.
Paint all ten of the hexagons in column one green.

Moving left to right, paint every other column green, leaving a column of blank hexagons between each, making each column one less hexagon than the last so that the last column of greens (column seventeen) has only the first two hexagons painted green and column eighteen is not painted at all yet.
Paint the last hexagon in column two green.
Paint the second to last hexagon in column four green and continue painting hexagons green to make a diagonal line ending with the last hexagon in column six.
Continue painting diagonal green lines copying the pattern from the diagonal line starting at the end of the green line of hexagons in column three for the rest of the straight green lines.
Paint all tiles purple in the fifth column from the left.
Paint a purple line, connecting from the fourth tile from the bottom of the far right column to the top of the purple column.
Counting from the upper left tile at the top of the connected triangle shaped purple lines, form a green line that goes between the third and fourth purple tile of the two lines, inside the triangle.

Leaving a blank line one tile thick between each green line, draw similar green lines parallel to the first one, continuing as far as the grid will allow when there are no more available tiles in the vertical column.
1. Make 5th column from left edge of grid all purple
Starting from top hexagon of this purple column, make a straight descending purple line that ends on the 4th hexagon from the bottom of the right edge column.
From this last hexagon of the descending line, proceed to make a green straight, descending line that ends on the bottom row of hexagons, the 7th from the right.

ascend back up the purple descending line you drew earlier to the third and fourth hexagons from the right. Adjacent to these begin another straight descending line of 7 green hexagons that ends on the bottom row on the hexagon that is 8th from the left side.

in between the two green descending lines of hexagons you have made, you should have a white descending line that separates the two green lines. Continue this regulated pattern of alternating green and white lines.  All of the remaining green lines should begin and end adjacent to the purple lines you have drawn.
All hexagons other than the purple and green lines instructed here should remain white.
Pick purple and color the fifth column from top to bottom.
Using the same color, paint the diagonal going downright till you reach the end.
Now, change the color to green and paint the third tile in the sixth column and its upper right neighbor to form a little diagonal.
Following the same diagonal pattern, paint five more by skipping every other row to meet the purple downright line.
In the leftmost column, color the 5th tile from the bottom GREEN.
Color the bottommost tile in the 10th column from the left GREEN.
Color the topmost tile in the 11th column from the left GREEN.
Fill in (GREEN) the two diagonals between the three green points you made in the above steps to make a "V" opening to the right.

For the second tile from the bottom in the 10th column from the left, and every OTHER tile to the left, following the bottom arm of the "V", color these tiles YELLOW. There should be 4 yellow tiles in all.
For each of the yellow tiles, extend vertically (YELLOW) up to meet the upper arm of the green "V". Do not color any tiles outside the "V".
Use green to make a diagonal line from the 6th spot on the first column to the first spot in the 11th column, and the last spot in the 10th column.
fill in the 10th column between the green spots with yellow.
Use yellow to make a solid vertical line in every other column inside the diagonal lines.
Make a green less-than sign (<) starting at the sixth tile of the first column and extending to the edge of the drawing area.
Color the tiles yellow between the top part of the < sign and the bottom part of the < sign in every other column starting with the fourth column and not extending past the < sign.
In columns # 1, 3, 13, and 15 paint the third and fourth tile down orange paint the sixth and seventh tiles down purple and paint the 2 bottommost tiles blue.
In columns, # 2 and 14 paint the second, fourth, and ninth tiles down orange, paint the third, fifth, and seventh tiles down purple, paint the sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down blue.
In columns # 5, and 7 paint the third and fourth tile down blue, paint the sixth and seventh tiles down orange, and paint the 2 bottommost tiles purple.
In column # 6 paint the second, fourth, and ninth tiles down blue, paint the third, fifth, and seventh tiles down orange, paint the sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down purple.
In columns, # 9, and 11 paint the third and fourth tile down purple, paint the sixth and seventh tiles down blue and paint the 2 bottommost tiles orange.
In column # 10 paint the second, fourth, and ninth tiles down purple, paint the third, fifth, and seventh tiles down blue, paint the sixth, eighth and tenth tiles down orange.
Leaving the center tile blank, draw a blue flower, using six tiles in the lower left corner.
Directly above the blue flower, draw a purple flower in the same way, and an orange flower above that one, so that the three flowers touch forming a stack.

Draw a similar stack of flowers with their blank centers in the sixth column from the left, starting with purple at the bottom, then orange, then blue, going up, so that there is a blank column between the two stacks of flowers.
Repeat this shape pattern two more times using orange, blue, purple centered in the tenth column and blue, purple, orange centered in the fourteenth column, counting colors from bottom to top.
Place an orange center in each blue flower, a blue center in each purple flower, and a purple center in each orange flower.
Use purple to shade the 3rd spot in the 2nd column, 6th spot in the 6th column, 9th spot in the 10th column, and the 3rd spot in the 14th column.
Use blue to shade the 6th spot in the 2nd column, 9th spot in the 6th column, 3rd spot in the 10th column, and 6th spot in the 14th column.
Use orange to shade the 9th spot in the 2nd column, 3rd spot in the 6th column, 6th spot in the 10th column, and 9th spot in the 14th column.
Encircle the purple dots with orange, blue dots with purple, and orange dots with blue.
Starting in the top left corner, paint the tiles of the top horizontal row the following colors: one red, two blue, one red, one blue, two red, one blue, one red.
Directly beneath the painted tiles, paint green and yellow vertical columns of five touching tiles, using green below the red tiles and yellow below the blue tiles.
Working across the top of the board from left to right, color the cells that extend up from the body in the following order: red, blue, blue, red, blue, red, red, blue, red.
Extending straight down from the cells colored in the previous step, add a line of 5 green cells if the one at the top is red.
Otherwise, add a line of 5 yellow cells extending straight down.
On the leftmost column, paint the first tile red. Grab green, and color the next five tiles under it.
Repeat this coloring pattern for the 7th, 11th, 13th and 17th columns.
Now, pick blue, and color the topmost tiles in the 3rd, 5th, 9th, 15th columns.
To finish the picture, use yellow, and paint five tiles under each blue one.
Starting in column one, tile 4, paint four tiles going diagonally, downwards and to the right, red.
Keep going down that same diagonal line by painting the next tile green, the next leaving white, and the one after it orange.
From there, paint the rest of the tiles in the diagonal line blue, until you end with the last tile which should be the last one in column fourteen.
Starting in column one, tile 9, paint four tiles going diagonally, upwards, and to the right, blue.
Keep going up that same diagonal line by painting the next tile orange, the next leaving white, and the one after it green.
From there, paint the rest of the tiles in the diagonal line red, until you end with the last tile which should be the first one in column seventeen.
In column six, paint tiles 1-4 blue.
In the same column, paint tile 5 orange, and tile 7 green.
Paint the remainder of the tiles in column six red.
Alternating between orange and green, paint the 6 cells around the cell located at the 6th column from the left and 5th row from the bottom. The top of the ring should be orange.
For each of the 3 orange cells, paint a straight blue line to the end of the grid so that the first blue cell is only touching the orange cell.
For each of the 3 green cells, paint a straight red line to the end of the grid so that the first red cell is only touching the green cell.
Color the first 4 spots in the 6th column blue.
Make the 5th spot orange, and the 7th spot green.
Color the last three spots red.

This will be a pattern that repeats itself on different rows. Starting in the 2nd column from the left, the 2nd tile down will be blank. The 6 tiles surrounding this blank tile will be purple. This makes a flower.

on sixth tile from the left, starting at the top, color top three tiles orange and the two centered tiles to the left of those three, and the one centered to the left of those, orange. continue skipping and increasing each brand by one until you have a 4 spot branch.

1. On the second row, second tile down from the top, leave that tile blank but color ALL tiles that touch it Blue, this makes a circle.

3, Counting from Right to left, on the fifth row (vertical) from right, fifth row (horizontal) from top downwards, leave that tile blank, then leave all 6 tiles that surround that (central) tile, blank, then leave the 12 tiles that surround those 6 tiles (still in center) blank also, and do color in the 18 tiles surrounding those tiles blue.

There are 6 tiles surrounding (and touching) our center, color them red.
There are 12 tiles touching and surrounding these red tiles. Color them yellow.
There are 18 tiles surrounding these yellow tiles. Color them green.
There are 24 tiles surrounding these green tiles. Color them orange and we are done!

1. You are drawing a labyrinth design.
All of the hexagons in design are purple.

Begin at the very bottom hexagon of the second column of hexagons.  draw a straight line upward, filling in each hexagon until you reach the top. Continue to the right along on the top row and color until you get to the 5th hexagon from the right edge.

Color this fifth hexagon from right edge purple, and color also the hexagon that is adjacent to it, and second from the top of column 4. These corner three hexagons should be a straight, descending line.

From the third hexagon in this straight corner of the labyrinth, begin with the third hexagon in the line heading right (it is in the second position from the top of the fourth column of hexagons from the right). Color it purple and continue to color purple the next 7 hexagons in this column. Do not color the last hexagon.
Then, move to next column to the left and create a mirror image corner as you made at  the top. It should have the same straight  but descending line consisting of 3 hexagons.

From there continue along this row (which is second from the bottom and is 'bumpy') coloring 9 more hexagons purple until you reach the third row from the left of hexagons and this hexagon should be white.
Ascend up this 4th column from left coloring 6 hexagons purple. The next hexagon should be white in this columns, and make a right turn, coloring the next 8 hexagons in this row purple.

From there, move one position down in the 6th column from the right and color this hexagon purple so that you have a straight descending line (from left to right) of three hexagons that is parallel to outer corner described in step 4.

From this hexagons, continue coloring directly down the sixth column from the right three more hexagons. At this last purple hexagon, you will turn and move left and color purple the next 5 hexagons in this row (the fourth row from the bottom).

After this 6th purple hexagon in this row, drop down to the third row from the bottom and color purple the adjacent hexagon. For the next hexagon heading left, move back up to the fourth row from the bottom and color the adjacent hexagon.
From there, shift in the upward direction and color the next two hexagons purple in this sixth column from the left.
From here, head right and color the next four hexagons purple.
All hexagons not purple should be white.
To start making a striped butterfly shape, color the two middle tiles in the ninth column blue.
Next, color the three tiles directly to the right and left of the blue tiles yellow. This will begin the wings.

Keep adding to the wings by adding stripes of color beginning with orange, then purple, red, and finally green. Each stripe will have one more tile colored in than the previous stripe resulting in the wing shapes.
Choose the color green. Fill in the fourth column from the left, starting at the second-highest hexagon. Fill in the second hexagon, all the way to the eighth hexagon in the same column.
Repeat the same thing to the fifth column from the RIGHT so that they look the same.
Choose the color red. Fill the fifth column from the left, starting at the third-highest hexagon. Fill in the third hexagon, all the way to the eighth hexagon in the same column.
Repeat the same thing to the sixth column from the RIGHT so that it looks the same as in step 5.

Choose the color purple and fill in the sixth column from the left, starting at the third-highest hexagon. Fill in the third hexagon to the seventh hexagon in the same column. Repeat the same thing to the seventh column from the RIGHT so that it looks the same.

Choose the color orange and fill in the seventh column from the left, starting at the fourth-highest hexagon. Fill in the fourth hexagon all the way the seventh hexagon in the same column. Repeat the same thing to the eighth column from the right side so that both columns look the same.

Choose the color yellow and fill in the eight-column from the left, starting at the fourth-highest hexagon. Fill in the fourth hexagon to the sixth hexagon in the same column. Skip the column next to it, on its right, and repeat the same thing to that column so that they look the same.
Finally, choose the color blue and fill in the ninth column from the left, starting at the fifth hexagon and ending at the sixth hexagon in the same column.
