Make the tile to the right of the top two purple tiles purple also, and repeat this pattern for each of the other arms of the snowflake.
color orange hexagons 5 and 6 from the bottom of column 3 from the right side. color orange the hexagon that is adjacent to both of these in column 4 from the right side--should have an orange triad.

repeat this shape three times heading straight to the left and make sure that the next one touches the one before it--after the orange, make an identical blue one, then a green one, and then a red one.

using the red triad as an axis point, do the opposite sequence of colored triads, the first series of triads heading in a straight ascending line until it ends with an orange triad that touches the top row of the grid.
the second series of triads also begins at the red triad but descends until it touches the bottom row of grid.  The last orange triad is also cut off, missing its lower right hexagon.
Beginning with the fourth cell that extends up from the body of the board, create an orange pyramid by coloring that cell orange, and the cells to its left and bottom orange.
Attach a blue pyramid to the pyramid created in the previous step by painting the cell directly below it and the one to the bottom right of it blue and coloring the cell that touches both blue.
Building on the lowest cell in step 2, repeat step 2 in green.
Building on the lowest cell in step 3, repeat step 2 in red.
Create a green pyramid extending to the right of two red cells, by adding one green cell then adding 2 green to the right side of those.
Repeat step 5 to attach a blue pyramid to the right of the green pyramid.
Repeat step 6 to attach an orange pyramid to the right of the blue pyramid.
Attach a green pyramid to the bottom left of the red pyramid.
Attach a blue pyramid to the bottom left of the green pyramid.
Attach a partial (2 cell) orange pyramid to the bottom left of the blue pyramid.
On the ninth column, paint the sixth tile, its upper right tile and the one under it red.
Going rightwards, follow the same triangle pattern and create three more in green, blue and orange.
Continue with the same coloring pattern and create two more sets of those triangles, in the upper left and down left direction from the red one.
The last orange triangle will have one tile missing.
Count nine columns from the left, then six hexagons down. Color the sixth hexagon purple.
Add purple hexagons to every hexagon connected to that one to create a small purple flower.
On the eighth column from the left, starting with the two purple hexagons, color in green the three above those.
To the left of the green line, color two connecting hexagons green, then one more, creating a pyramid pointing to the left.

One corner of the green pyramid is connected to the purple flower. On the other two corners, color in red two hexagons connected only to one green hexagon, then one hexagon connected to both of the red hexagons, so you have two tiny pyramids coming off the green one.
Back to the eighth column, on the bottom of the two purple hexagons draw three green hexagons going down. Then color two and one green so you have another green pyramid pointing left.
On one corner draw the red three hexagon pyramid, on the lower corner you will only have room for two of the red hexagons.
Count eleven columns from the left, then six hexagons down. Color in green the sixth hexagon.
The green hexagon is the tip of our last pyramid, color two then three to the right to make a pyramid pointing left.
One corner of the pyramid is connected to the purple flower, draw the little red pyramids on the other two corners to match the other two green pyramids.
Use purple to fill in the 6th spot on the 9th column.
Make a circle around that spot with purple.
Use green to fill in the 2nd-4th and 7th-9th spots on the 8th column.
Fill in two spots to the left of each of the green lines you just made.
Fill in 1 spot on the left of the green spots you just filled in.
Make another small green triangle starting at the 6th spot on the 11th column, and moving to the right.
Use red to fill in the 3rd and 8th spots in the 4th column, and 3rd, 4th, 8th, and 9th spots in the 5th column.
continue to fill in the 1st and last spot on the 8th column, and 1st, 2nd, and last spots on the 9th column.
Keep going to fill the 4th and 8th spots on the 13th column.
Finally fill the 3rd, 4th, 7th, and 8th spots on the 14th column.
Paint the sixth hexagon in column nine purple as well as all of the hexagons touching it to make a circle with a hexagon in the middle all painted purple.
Paint the sixth hexagon in column eleven green, the fifth and sixth in column twelve green, and the fifth, sixth, and seventh in column thirteen green, to make a triangle.
Copy the green triangle again starting with hexagon seven in column eight, and again starting with hexagon four in the same column, to make two more green triangles the same as the first.

Paint hexagons three in column four as well as hexagons three and four in column five to make a red triangle and then copy the red triangle starting with the first hexagon in column eight and the first two hexagons in column nine as well.
Copy the pattern to make two more red triangles on the corners of the green triangle in column thirteen.
Add another red triangle to the corner of the green triangle starting in column five with hexagons eight and nine as well as hexagon eight in the column before.
Paint the last hexagon in columns eight and nine red.
Use purple to make a flower in the top right corner by filling in the 1st spots in the last 3 columns, the 2nds spots in the last and 16th columns, and the 3rd in the 17th column.
Fill the middle with blue and fill the 1st spot in the 15th column blue as well.
Make a red flower by filling the 1st spots in the 8th-10th columns, and create the flower shape from there.
Make two more red flowers connected diagonally to the bottom right corners to form a chain.
Fill in the centers with yellow and fill the 1st spot in the 7th, and the 6th spots in the last two columns to complete the chain of daisies look.
Move to the 2nd spots in the 2nd-4th columns to fill with yellow, and make a yellow daisy chain with red centers.
Now make a purple daisy in the 6th spots of the 2nd-4th columns, and finish the centers and chain with blue.

Using blue and counting from the top right, paint the second tile of the column two and the top tile of column four, then counting from the bottom left, paint the fifth tile of column one, the fourth tile of column three, the third tile of column six, the second tile of column eight and the bottom tile of columns nine and ten.

Counting from the upper left, using yellow, paint the top tile of column seven, the second tile of column nine, the third tile of column twelve, the fifth tile of column fifteen, the sixth tile of columns seventeen and eighteen.

Using red, counting from the bottom right, paint the bottom tile of column one and two, the second tile of column four, the fourth tile of column seven, the fifth tile of column ten, seventh tile of column thirteen, the eighth tile of column sixteen and the ninth tile of the leftmost column.
Paint a purple ring in the adjacent tiles around the blue tiles in column two from the right, and in columns three and six from the left.
Paint a red ring around the yellow tiles in columns four, seven, and ten from the right.
Paint a yellow ring around the red tiles in columns four, seven, ten, thirteen, and sixteen, counting from the right.
Draw a yellow circle shape of six hexes with the topmost hex in the 3rd row from the left, 2nd hex from the top. Color the hex inside the circle red.
Draw 4 more yellow circles with red centers, the upper-right hex of the next circle touching the lower-right hex of the last.
Fill the bottom-right most hex red, as well as the hex touching it on top-left, and fill the 2nd hex from the top in the left-most column red.
Draw two purple circles aligned vertically with the first two yellow circles, with one white hex between the bottom-most part of the yellow circles and the top-most hex of the purple circles.

Fill the hex in the center of the purple circles with blue, and continue filling blue to make a line "behind" the purple circles across the grid (one blue hex to the top-left of the first purple circle, three blue hexes to the bottom-right of the second)
Draw three red circles vertically aligned with the last three yellow circles, one white hex between the tops of the yellow circles and bottom of the red circles.
Fill the hex in the center of the red circles yellow and again fill out a yellow line "behind" the circles (one yellow hex to the top-left, two yellow hexes to the bottom-right).
Draw a purple cirvle in the top-right corner of the grid. Fill the center hex blue, and fill the hex to the top-left of the circle blue
Fill the entire 16th column with blue.
Create a yellow flower to the left of that line by filling the 2nd and 3rd spots in columns 15 and 13, and the 1st and 3rd spots of the 14th column, then fill in the middle with orange.
Create the same flower in below that one in spots 7-9 of those same columns.
Make two identical flowers in line with those in columns 1-3.
Create a red X between those 4 flowers.

Create a green circle by filling in the 5th and 6th spots in the 5th and 11th columns, the 3rd and 7th spots in the 6th and 10th columns, the 3rd and 8th spots in the 7th and 9th columns, and the 1st and 8th spots in the 10th column.
fill in that circle with purple, leaving the red lines in tact.
On second row from top and left downward, color the tile orange. Now color all tiles touching that tile, yellow.
Color another "flower" like this using the orange center the third tile from bottom, second row from left.
Create two more of these flowers or patterns using the orange center tile on second row from top, fifth row leftward from right most row. and third tile from bottom on the same row.
Connect all 4 of these flowers with an X shape of red tiles crossing to connect all flowers diagonally. There will be a distance of 9 red tiles each way, reusing the center tile in the count.

On 8th column of tiles from the left, third from bottom color that tile green, then connect from that tile in the most direct way to the red line of tiles to touch diagonally from left and from right. This will create a sort of arc of 5 green tiles in the lower quadrant here.
Mirror this configuration in the top part above the X. Utilizing the second tile from the top as the peak, 8th column from left.
Continue the sort of interrupted green circle of hex tiles by adding two tiles on the fifth column from left, fifth and sixth down, and mirror that on the right side of the image.
All remaining tiles between the green and red inside of the circle should be colored purple. There are 10 of these tiles.
Color the entire third column from right going leftward, blue, top to bottom.
Fill a yellow circle using six hexes in as far in the top-left corner as you can. Fill the hex in the center of the circle orange.
Fill a red line 9 hexes long starting from the lower-right corner of the flower, filling toward the bottom-right corner of the grid.
At the end of the red line, fill another yellow circle with orange center, the top-left corner of the circle touching the red line.
Mirror the red-line and circle shapes horizontally and vertically to form a red X with circles at the end in all 4 corners.
Fill the 3rd column from the right entirely with blue.
Fill the 2 hexes above and 2 hexes below the red hex in the center of the red X intersection with purple.
Fill the middle hex to the left and right of both sets of 2 purple hexes with purple
In the white area enclosed by the left and right arms of the X, fill the hex closes to the intersection on each side with purple.
Surround the purple with a green hexes, to form an apparent green circle 1-hex wide below the red X shape.
Counting from the upper left, in columns five, nine, and thirteen, paint tiles four and five yellow, then paint the adjacent tile to either side of each pair yellow, as well.
Still using yellow, paint the lower tile of the pairs of blank tiles adjacent to and between the three yellow shapes.
Paint a black border, using all the adjacent tiles surrounding the yellow figure.

Paint a diagonal blue line ascending from the bottom tile of the fourth column from the left to the third tile from the top of the rightmost column, skipping over the three black tiles along that line, leaving those black.

Continuing with blue, draw a parallel line, above the first blue line, going from edge to edge of the grid, leaving a thickness of two blank tiles tiles between the blue lines and skipping over any tiles already painted.
Repeat step five.
Paint two green tiles directly above the outermost  blue tiles of the lowest blue line and directly below the outermost tiles of the top blue line.
Fill the 4th hex from the top in the 5th column from the left yellow.
Fill the three hexes underneath the first with yellow also.
Fill the hex to the lower-right of the right-most yellow hex with yellow.

Repeat this shape of 5 hexes twice more, vertically aligned but horizontally offset so that the leftmost hex of the new shape shares its lower-left edge with the upper-right edge of the left-most hex of the previous shape
Change the right-most yellow hex to black
Change every white hex touching to a yellow hex black so the 4 connected yellow shapes are surrounded with black.

Fill a line of blue starting with the 3rd hex down in the rightmost column, filling in a down/left direction. Continue to the bottom of the grid, but leaving the 3 hexes that are already black as black.

Fill a line of blue starting with the 2nd hex from the bottom in the left-most column, filling in a up-right direction. Continue to the top of the grid, but leaving the 7 hexes that are already black and yellow as-is.

Fill a line of blue starting with the 6th hex from the top in the left-most column, filling in a up-right direction. Continue to the top of the grid, but leaving the 4 hexes that are already black and yellow as-is.
Fill the two hexes above the bottom-most hex of the lowest blue line with green; do the same for the two hexes above the top-most hex in the lowest blue line.
Fill the two hexes below the left-most hex of the highest blue line with green; do the same for the two hexes below the right-most hex in the highest blue line.
in the 1st column, leave the bottom cell white, then paint blue, 2 greens, and a blue going upward
in the 2nd column, paint the 3rd and 6th tiles from the bottom blue.
from the bottom 2 blue cells, continue painting a diagonal blue line for the next 4 columns
in the 4th column, paint the bottom cell blue, then the next 2 cells up green, then the next cell up blue.
paint the bottom cell in the 5th column blue
continue painting a diagonal blue line for the next 7 columns
using black, paint the 4th and 5th cells from the top of column three
paint diagonal black lines upwards and downwards for the next 2 columns to the right
in column 6, paint the 3rd and 5th cells black.
in column 7, paint the 4th and 6th cells black
in column 8, paint the 3rd and 5th cells black
in column 9, recreate the same black pattern two more times, and the close the black oval shape in column 15
paint the entire inside of the black oval yellow
continue the 3 diagonal blue lines on the other side of the oval until the reach the end of the grid.
in column 11, paint the 2nd and 3rd cells from the top green
in the last column, paint the top 2 cells green

On Third row from left third tile from top, color the hex there yellow. Color all tiles touching it, blue. Color the tile to the left of the hex circle, centered on it, blue, mirror that and color blue the center tile to the right of the image.
below the center of the image, lowest blue tile, color the three tiles down from there, red.
Below the bottom red tile colored, repeat the image completed in step 1, shape and color.
On 9th column from left (row) center another image created in steps 1, 2, and 3, just center the image there on 9th column instead of third column from left.
Repeat this yet again, centering it on the 4th column from the right (going leftward.
Paint the third and ninth hexagons in columns three, nine, and fifteen yellow and all those surrounding them blue.
Paint hexagons three and nine in columns one, five, seven, eleven, thirteen, and seventeen all blue.
Paint hexagons five, six, and seven of columns three, nine, and fifteen red.
Use blue to fill the 2nd and 4th dots in the 3rd column,  and create diagonal lines up and down that meet at the 3rd dot in the 1st column and the 3rd dot in the 5th column.
Create another diamond shape at the bottom of the same column.
Create these diamonds on columns 9 and 15 at the top and bottom.
Fill the center spaces with yellow.
Fill in the 3 spaces between each set with red to connect them top to bottom.

On fourth row from left, starting at the top tile, color the top three tiles yellow, The fourth tile here should be blue. The tiles just above and to the right and then just above and to the right, should be yellow. The other three tiles uncolored beside the blue tile should be purple. The two tiles below the bottommost purple tile should likewise be purple.

Create an image exactly in shape, as was created in Step 1, Starting at the top tile of column 8, colorwise the top of this image will be purple, the single tile below the purple will be black, then the bottom here is yellow (the 5 tiles that seem like a y).
Repeat the exact shape and color done in step 1, starting it on the 12th row from left. Top tile there, going downwards, exactly as 1.
Repeat the exact pattern in step to again but starting on the top tile on the third row from the right counting leftwards.

Use yellow to fill the top 3 spots on the 4th and 12th columns, the 5th-7th spots on the 8th and 16th columns, the 4th spots on the 3rd, 5th, 11th, and 13th columns, and the 5th spots in the 7th, 9th, 15th and 17th columns.

Use purple to fill the top 3 spots in the 8th and 16th columns, the 5th-7th spots in the 4th and 12th columns, the 4th spots in the 7th, 9th, 14th, and 16th columns, and the 5th spots in the 3rd, 5th, 11th, and 13th spots.
Fill the 4th spot in the 4th and 12th columns with blue, and the 8th, and 16th columns with black.
Starting from the top and right, color the fourth tile in columns three, seven, eleven, and fifteen, alternating black and blue, beginning with black.
Beginning with the black tile on the right, color the three adjacent tiles above the black tile purple, then color the next two tiles moving up the column above the black tile purple as well.
Switching to yellow, color the tiles below the black tile symmetrically to the purple ones above.
Continuing with purple and yellow, repeat the pattern established in the previous two steps, for each of the remaining blue and black tiles, alternating color top to bottom and right to left.

Paint a diagonal row of black hexagons starting with the fifth hexagon in column one and ending with the first hexagon in nine and then continuing down to end with hexagon five in the last column to make another diagonal line.
Paint two more black diagonal lines starting with the sixth hexagon in column one and ending with the last hexagon in column ten and then continuing to the sixth hexagon in the last column.

Paint a red triangle of hexagons inside the black one by painting hexagons red starting with hexagon five in column four and continuing to the third hexagon in column nine and then down to the sixth hexagon in fifteen and then to hexagon eight in column ten and up to hexagon five in column four.
Paint the fifth hexagon in column two purple as well as the fifth and sixth in columns three.
Paint the fifth hexagon in column six and hexagons five and six in column seven purple as well as the same three hexagons on the opposite corner of the red diamond.
Paint hexagon five and six in column sixteen purple as well as hexagon six in column seventeen.
Using black fill in the 5th and 6th spots in the 1st column, and go diagonally up from the 5th spot to the top, and diagonally down from the 6th spot to the bottom.
Start at the black spots on the 9th column, and make diagonal lines going to the right to end at the 5th and 6th spots at the last column.
Use purple to fill the 3 spots in the right and left corners of the black shape.
Use red to create the shape concentrically inside the black shape with a white border.
Fill the 3 spaces in the right and left corners of the red shape.
Fill the top-most hex in the 9th column from the left with black.
Fill lines in both directions from the first black hex (bottom-left and bottom-right direction) all the way to edges of the grid.
Fill the bottom-most hex in the 10th column from the left and in black fill black lines in both directions (top-left and top-right direction) all the way to edges of the grid.
Draw a single-width red shape inside the the black shape with one white hex in between on all sides.
Fill the three left-most and three right-most hexes inside the red shape with purple.
Fill the left-most three and right-most three hexes in the white area between the black and red shapes with purple.

Use purple to make a diagonal line from the 1st spot in the 1st column to the next to last spot in the next to last column, and one from the last spot in the 1st column to the 2nd spot in the next to last column.
Use orange to completely fill the 3rd, 6th, 9th, 12th, 15th, and 18th columns.
Counting from the top right, centered on the fifth tile in the ninth column, draw lines to form a purple X, extending as far as the grid will allow.
Beginning with the first column at the far right, color the entire column orange, converting any purple tiles to orange, as needed.
Continuing from right to left, skip the next two columns, then color the next one after that orange, converting any purple tiles as needed.
Repeat step three across the grid as far as possible.
Paint all of the hexagons in columns three, six, nine, twelve, fifteen, and eighteen orange.

Paint a purple diagonal line starting with the first hexagon in the first column and ending with the second to last hexagon in the second to last column, skipping the hexagons that have already been painted orange.

Paint another diagonal purple line of hexagons, starting with the last hexagon in the first column and ending with the second hexagon in the second to last column, skipping the hexagons that have already been painted orange.
Paint the second and third hexagons in columns one, five, nine, thirteen, and seventeen red as well as the eighth and ninth hexagons in the same columns.
Paint the second hexagons in column two green as well as the second and third in column three and the second in column four.
Copy the pattern of green hexagons between all of the red hexagons in both the first and second rows.
Paint hexagon five in column eight, hexagons five and six in column nine, and hexagon five in column ten all red.
Paint the fifth and sixth hexagons in columns seven and eleven green.
Use red to fill in the 2nd, 3rd, 8th, and 9th spots in the 1st, 5th, 9th, 13th, and 17th columns, the 5th spots in the 8th-10th columns, and the 6th spot in the 9th columns.

Use green to fill the 2nd and 8th spots in the 2nd-4th, 6th-8th, 10th-12th, and 14th-16th columns, the 3rd and 9th spots in the 3rd, 7th, 11th, and 15th columns, and the 5th and 6th spots in the 7th and 11th columns.
In the left-most column, fill the 2nd and 3rd hex from the top with red.
In the 3rd column from the left, fill the 2nd and 3rd hex from the top with green.
Repeat the two-column pattern alternating red and green lines with a white column inbetween, filling 4 more columns with red and 3 more columns with green
In the white columns in between the lines, fill the single hex that touches the middle of both lines in each column with green (8 hexes total)
Repeat the full pattern near the bottom of the grid, with the first red strip in the left-most column, using the 2nd and 3rd hexes from the bottom.
In the center of the grid, fill the two vertical hexes in the middle with red, using the same column as the center red lines, a single white hex between them.
Fill two green lines of 2 hexes each on either side of the middle red one, again parallel to the vertical green lines above with a white hex in between above and below.
Fill the center hexes between the three most recently drawn lines (on either side of the middle red line) with red.
Fill the top hex in the 3rd column from the left red.
Fill hexes to the bottom-left and bottom-right of the first in red.
Continuing the line in both directions, fill hexes to the bottom-left and bottom-right of the last two in red.
Mirror the 5 red hexes on the horizontal axis to form an elliptical shape with surrounding 4 empty white hexes
Draw a "stem" underneath, starting with the hex underneath the lowest red hex, filling 6 hexes in blue to reach the bottom of the grid.
Repeat the same elliptical shape with a stem, but with the ellipse in orange, and the top-most hex of the shape in the 8th column from the left.

Repeat the same elliptical shape with a stem, but with the ellipse in red again, starting with the top-most hex of the ellipse in the 13th column from the left, second hex from the top. The "stem" will only be 5 blue hexes.

Repeat the same elliptical shape with a stem, with the ellipse in orange, and the top-most hex of the shape in top hex of the column on the far-right of the grid. You will only be able to fill the left-half of the ellipse and the stem, the right-half is off the grid.
Use blue to make straight lines from the 5th dot to the bottom of the 3rd, 8th, and 18th columns and from the 6th dot to the bottom of the 13th column.
Create a red circle atop the 1st blue line by filling in the 2nd and 3rd dots on the 1st and 5th columns, and going up and down to the 1st and 4th dots on the 3rd column.
Use orange to make this shape on the next blue line, and red to make it on the next blue line.
Create half this shape with orange on the last blue line.
Counting from the right, with blue, paint the bottom six tiles of columns one, eleven, and sixteen, and a stack of five blue tiles at the bottom of column six.
Beginning in the tile directly above the far left blue column draw a red V ascending three tiles high, then cap it with a downward facing V of the same color.
Top the next blue column to the right with an orange shape like the one from the previous step.
Top the next column with a red shape like the one in step two and the final column on the right with as much of an orange shape as the grid allows.
In the left-most column fill the 2nd and 3rd hex from the top orange
Fill the hex between the first two on the right with orange
Fill two hexes to the right int he 3rd column from the left with orange to form a bow-tie shape.
Repeat the orange bow-tie shape 5 more times, with the bottom-right hex of the last bowtie touching the top-left hex of the next, so that the final bow-tie is in the very bottom-right corner.
Put a blue bow-tie shape in the very bottom-left corner of the grid (first 2 hexes in the bottom of the left-most column)
Repeat 5 more bow ties shapes in the opposite diagonal to orange so that the last blue bow-tie is in the top-right corner of the grid.
The two hexes near the middle that switch from orange to blue (where the two diagonal lines of bow-ties overlap) should be filled black.
Make the 6th dots in the 7th and 9th columns black.
Make the 2nd and 3rd dots in the 1st and 3rd columns orange.
Make the 2nd dot in the 2nd column orange.
Repeat this shape in orange down to the right diagonally starting at the 3rd and 4th dots in the 4th column.
Repeat again down to the right diagonally, but leave the black dots.
Continue to repeat this shape diagonally to the bottom right corner.
Start at the right side and use blue to fill in the 1st two dots on the last column.
Create a mirror image of the orange shapes in blue by creating the shape, and repeating it down to the left diagonally to the bottom of the first column.
Color an orange 5 hex tile configuration that mimics a bow tie, centering it second column from left, second tile from top.
Repeat the pattern in 1, making another orange bow tie that touches the bottom most right of the "Bone" in step 1 to the topmost left part of the "bone" you are creating here.
Repeat the pattern and placement done in step 2, however the bottom 2 tiles here will be black, the rest is orange (three upper most tiles used for bow tie).
Repeat the same bow tie configuration three more times mimicking the patterns done so far, bottom right most touching next top leftmost bow tie. You'll end at the very bottom most right side of grid.

Using bottom most two tiles on left most column, create a blue bow tie, consisting of 5 tiles in same shape as those in orange previously done. The two bottom tiles of left column make the left part of the bow tie.
Make another Blue bow tie, using top most part, right side upwards of Bow Tie made in Step 5.
Make the bottom part of another Blue bow tie, this will meld with the bottom of the bow tie made in step 3, those black tiles will appear as the top of this step's bow tie.
Using the top black tile, going to IT's right and up create yet another, blue bow tie. Repeat this same configuration and plan twice more, until reaching the right most column.
Fill 2 hexes in the 9th column from the left red, in the center of the grid, 5th and 6th hexes from the top
Fill the middle hexes to the left and right of the first hexes in red to form a UFO shape.

Fill hexes around the red UFO in green to form a hexagon with exactly 1 empty white hex between red and green. The hexagon will be three hexes long on the right and left, 4 hexes long on the two sides on either side above and below the red ones.

Fill hexes in blue to form another hexagon around the green one, again leaving 1 empty white hex between the green and the blue. The top and bottom-most hexes of the shape and the top and bottom-most hexes in the 9th column from the left.

Draw another hexagon shape around the blue one using red, again leaving 1 empty white hex between blue and red. The top and bottom of the shape are cropped off by the limits of the grid, the left and right side of the hexagon shape are 7 hexes high.
Use red to fill the 5th and 6th dot in the 9th column.
fill in the 5th dots on the 8th and 10th columns.
Leaving a white border, make a green circle around this shape starting by filling the 4th-6th dots on the 6th and 12th columns, and continuing up and down to the 3rd and 8th dots in the 9th column.
Leave a white border and create a blue circle around that, and red brackets that would be a circle if the board were taller.
In the 9th column from the left, color the 5th and 6th cells red
Color the two adjacent cells to the left and right of these red cells red as well, creating a 4-cell red diamond
Leave a blank circle of cells around the diamond, and encircle the figure in a green ring of hexes. The ring should extend from the 6th to the twelveth columns
Leaving another blank circle of cells, enclose the green ring in a blue circle of cells. This ring should touch the top and bottom edges of the board in the 9th column

Leaving another blank circle of cells, enclose the blue ring in a ring of red cells. The top and bottom of this circle will be cut off, so only the left and right sides will be drawn, resulting in a set of brackets
Fill the first three hexes in the left-most column with blue, starting at the top.
Fill the top two hexes in the 3rd and 5th column from the left with blue
Fill the top hex in the 4th column from the left with blue to make a bow-tie shape
Fill the top two hexes in the 9th column from the left in blue
Fill the top hex in the column on either side blue to make a UFO shape
Fill the top hex in the 14th column from the left in blue.
Repeat the pattern of these 4 shapes using purple, starting with three hexes in the left-most column directly underneath the blue ones.
Repeat the pattern of the 4 shapes using green, starting with three hexes in the left-most column directly underneath the purple ones.
Use blue to fill the first 3 dots of the 1st column.
Use purple to fill in the next 3 dots in the 1st column.
Use green to fill in the next 3 dots in the 1st column.
Use blue to fill in the 1st and 2nd dot in the 3rd and 5th columns.
fill in the 1st dot in the 4th, 8th, 10th, and 14th columns.
Fill in the 1st and 2nd dots in the 9th column.
Repeat the pattern in blue with the purple and green.
Color the top of the leftmost column (three tiles), blue.
Color the next three tiles (4-6) Purple on leftmost column.
Color the three tiles below the purple ones created in Step 2, Green. (leftmost column). leave bottom tile blank.
On top row, fourth from left, color it blue, make that tile the center of a bowtie shape, utilizing the two tiles to it's left and 2 to it's right. This bow tie will be made of a total of 5 tiles.
On 4th row from left, centered on 4th tile from top, center a purple bow tie there, replicating the design in step 4. It will be below the bow tie previously created (step 4).
Create a last green bowtie directly below the ones created in steps 4 and 5, centered on the 7th tile from top on 4th row from left. Utilizing 5 tiles, just like in step 4 and 5.
On columns 8, 9 and 10 color their top row's tiles blue. Add the centered tile below them as blue also.
On 9th column create a centered purple image that repeats step 7, leave one blank tile below the top of this design and the bottom of the one in 7.
Repeat the design of 7 and 8, leaving another blank tile between the top and bottom and coloring it green.
On 14th tile from (row) left, top row, color it blue.
Three tiles below top of 14th row (below tile colored in 10) color it purple.
Skip 2 more blank hex tiles and directly below the tile colored in 11, color that one Green.
Fill the top hex in the right-most column and the top hex in the 2nd from right-most column with blue, forming a short diagonal line.
Create a parallel diagonal line, skipping 1 white hex creating a line 6 hexes long in green
Continue the patter, creating alternate blue and green diagonal lines with 1 white line in between each across the grid. There will be 5 blue diagonal lines and 4 green diagonal lines in total.
In the 4th column from the left, fill the 3rd and 6th hex from the top with purple.
Fill 3 hexes to the left and 3 hexes to the right of those two in purple to form an "O" shape.
Repeat the purple "O" shape three more times, at the same height to the first, but leaving a column inbetween each so that the next 3 start are centered on the 8th, 12th, 16th column from the left
Clear the two hexes inside each purple "O" so they are all white.
Alternate diagonal blue and green stripes by staring at the top right side and making the first dots in the last two columns blue.
Skip the next diagonal row, and make the next one green from the top of the 13th columns to the 3rd dot in the last column.
Continue making alternating diagonal stripes to the bottom leaving the last dot in the 1st two columns white.

Create oblong circles by using purple to fill in the 4th-6th dots on the 3rd, 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 13th, 15th, and 17th columns, and close the tops and bottoms in the 4th, 8th, 12th, and 16th columns.
Make sure the insides of all the circles are white.
Starting with column two from the right, paint eight purple vertical trios of tiles in the even numbered columns two through sixteen, in tiles four through six from the top.
Form the first two trios from the right into an oval, by adding additional purple tiles connecting the top and bottom, leaving a blank vertical pair in the center of the oval.
Continuing to the left, repeat the action of step 2 for each pair of purple trios across.
Paint the top tile of the first and second columns from the right blue, forming a diagonal blue line.
Leaving a blank gap one tile thick, paint a green line parallel to the blue line, extending as far as the grid allows.
Continue drawing parallel lines, alternating blue and green, in the pattern established in the previous two steps, leaving the centers of the four ovals blank.
In the the 9th column from the left, color the top hex and the 3rd form the top red.
Color the two hexes inbetween on the left and right side red to form a circle.
Draw a purple circle of the same size, with it's top in the 6th column from the left, second hex from the top.
Mirror this with a circular pattern of hexes to the right of the red circle, filling with orange.

Mirror the three circle pattern, so the bottom-most hexes of the last two circles drawn touch the tops of the mirrored two side-circles. In clock-wise order, the 6 circles are filled red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple

On ninth tile from left on top most tile, color that red, then create a red ring of tiles, made up of 6 tiles, leaving one blank tile in center, below that with that ninth top tile as the top most of the ring.

On Sixth row from left, third tile from top, leave that tile blank but color purple, all tiles that touch it. This will create a purple ring just to the left and down from the red ring created in step one.
Directly below and touching the bottom of the purple ring, make a similarly formed blue ring (to step 2, just directly below it).

On Twelfth row from the left, third tile from top, make that the center of an orange ring, coloring all tiles touching this 12th tile, third from top, orange. Leave that center tile blank as in all other rings created.
Directly below the orange ring in Step 4, create a ring of yellow, topmost of this circle just touching and below the lowest orange tile formed in the ring of step 4.
Leaving 3 blank hex tiles below the bottom of the red circle created in step one, create a green ring, the top tile of that ring is the fourth tile below the bottom of the red tile in step 1's ring.
Use red to fill in the first two dots on the 8th and 10th columns.
fill in the 1st and 3rd dot on the 9th column to create a flower.
Use purple to make a flower in the 3rd and 4th dots on the 5th and 7th columns and complete it in the 6th column.
Make an orange flower on the other side of the red flower opposite the purple flower.
Create a blue flower directly below the purple flower, and  a yellow flower directly below the orange flower.
Complete the flower circle by making a green flower 1 dot up from the bottom under the red flower.
Starting in the 3rd cell from the top of the 3rd column from the left, draw a line of 5 blue hexes going down diagonally to the right.
Surround the ends of this line with orange hexes, so that they create a hexagon that is broken by the blue line.
Mirror this figure across column 9, so that it is identical but the blue line goes diagonally up and to the right from the 11th column.
Color blue the tiles From Third tile down on third column from left, then connect a blue line to column 7 fifth tile down, resulting in 5 blue tiles
Curling around each end of this line add 5 orange tiles so it looks like a sort of blue centered bone.

Create the exact same image in mirror form, each end of the mirror image created here will be located on third tile down and fourth column in from right side, going leftward. The other end of that blue bone portion will be 11th column from the left side fifth from top.
Starting in tile three from the top of the third column from the left and the fourth column from the right, paint descending diagonal lines of five blue tiles.
With orange, paint all the blank adjacent tiles that surround the endpoint tiles of each of the lines.
Draw an angle in orange starting in the top of the 3rd column from the left, going 4 hexes to the 3rd cell from the top of 6th column and then back to the 4th cell from the top in the 3rd column.
Mirror this angle below in red, so that the top line of the lower angle, which points left, is two cells below the orange angle. This angle has its point in the 3rd column and its ends in the 6th.
Mirror both angles across the 7th column, so that they start in the 8th column. Repeat the colors, if the angle points right, color it orange, if it points left color it red.
Mirror both angles one last time across the 12th column, again repeating the color scheme so that this iteration is identical to the first set drawn in steps 1 and 2
On 6th column from left, second tile down, color the tile orange, use that as a point, making a 7 tiled forward arrow.

On third column from right going leftward, second tile down, use that tile as another arrow, replicating in color and shape, step 1 (orange again).  Replicate this once more using the 11th Column from left, the 6th tile from top.
On Third column from left, 6th tile down from top, color this tile red, then make a backward facing arrow (as in pointing to the left here), using a total of 7 tiles.

Repeat the shape and color of Step 3, twice. The point of the first additional arrow will be 8th column from left, second tile from top. Lastly 6th columned tile from right going leftward 6th tile downward will be the last point of the last backward arrow. These backward arrows are all red.
Counting from the right, in columns three through six, form a horizontal orange V shape that is open on the its left side, with its narrow point on the right in the second tile down in column three.
Form a red V that opens to the right, beginning with its narrow point in column eight from the left, tile two from the top.
Make another left-facing orange V, with its narrow point in the second tile from the top of column six from the left.
Leaving a blank line one tile thick in between, place three more V shapes directly below the first three, in the reverse colors and facing the opposite direction from the first three.
Starting in the 4th cell of the 5th and 13th columns from the left, color the left cell yellow and the right cell orange.
From these cells extend three arms out two cells in the same color, going straight up and down diagonally to the left and right.
Surround each figure with a hexagon of the opposite color, orange on the left and yellow on the right.
Paint a vertical trio of orange tiles, starting in the second tile from the top of column six, counting from the right.
Beginning by descending diagonal lines from the top tile of that same column, paint a yellow hexagon, with four tiles on each side.
With orange connect the lower corners of the hexagon to the bottom tile of the orange trio.
Using the reverse colors, duplicate this design, starting in column five from the left with a yellow trio.
In the 5th column from the left fill the 4th hex from the top yellow.
Fill 3 yellow lines of 2 hexes each stretching out from the first yellow hex, each in a bottom-left, bottom-right, and straight-up direction
Fill the hex on-top of the top-most yellow hex orange, then fill lines of 3 more orange hexes each in a bottom-left and bottom-right direction.
Continue the orange lines straight down from their outer-most points, 3 hexes down on each side.
Finish enclosing the orange shape to form a large hexagon, 4 hexes on each side.
Repeat the complete shape filled so far, but with the colors inverted (a yellow hexagon enclosing three orange lines) with the top hex of the new shape in the top of the 6th column from the right.
Starting at the top of the third column, color a line of hexes going diagonally down to the right, in order coloring 3 purple, 3 orange, 3 blue and three purple again, for a line of 12 hexes.
Then starting in the 3rd hex from the top of column five, repeat step one, so that you've drawn another line of 12 hexes in purple, orange, blue and purple again directly below the first line.
At the end of each color segment of the line on top (the first line) color two hexes extending diagonally up and to the right in the same color of the segment.

At the start of each color segment of the line on the bottom (the second line) color two hexes extending diagonally down and to the left the same color of the segment that is starting. There will now be four Xs drawn on the board.
Fill a purple V shaped line, starting with the top-most hex in the third column from the left, filling 3 hexes to the bottom-right, then 2 hexes toward the top-right.
Mirror the V shape to form an upside-down purple V with the center hex directly below the center hex of the first V shape.
Repeat the same double-V shape using orange, with the first orange hex just to the right of the two purple hexes in the center of the first double-V, touching them.
Repeat the double-V shape in blue, the top-left hex touching the center two hexes of the orange double-V
Repeat the double-V shape in purple, the top-left hex touching the center two hexes of the blue double-V.

Create a sort of "Jacks" image, as in jacks thrown playing hop scotch. First color purple the tiles: Topmost, third column from left, top fourth column from left, second from top on fifth column from left. Top of sixth column and seventh column from left. Now create a mirror image of this, so that if you folded with paper you'd fold along the bottom, or lowest tile in this image.

Create another image with the same orientation of tiles, but make it orange, The top and left most tile of the second "Jack" will nestle in the axis of the central part of the purple initial jack going down, in turn the right bottom of the initial purple jacks will nestle in the right axial part of the orange jack you are creating. orienting it diagonally downward.
Repeat this shape and orientation with a blue Jack, continuing the downward horizontal orientation.

Finalize the design, constructing a final purple Jack to the right diagonally down from the blue one, resulting in 4 identically shaped and formed jacks. They are oriented to create a horizontally downward sloping line.
Starting in the leftmost column, color the 6th hex green in each column skipping every 4th column.
In the 4th, 8th... etc column, color the 5th hex from the top green, creating a zig-zag line across the board

Starting the column second from the left color in cells in every other column. If the column falls where the line dips down, color the two cells above the green line orange. If the green line is at a peak in the column, color the two cells below blue.
Color green the fifth tile from the top of every fourth row from the left.
In the rest of the columns, color green each tile that is sixth from the top.
Color the fourth and fifth tile from top orange on the second column from left.
Color the fourth and fifth tiles (from top) orange of every fourth row, leaving three blank rows between, after step 2.
From top, color Blue the 6th and 7th tiles down. Begin this starting from the fourth row from the left. Continue this pattern, leaving 3 blank rows between, making 4 pairs of blue tiles total.

Beginning in the far right column, starting in the fifth tile from the bottom, paint a green line that zigzags horizontally across the grid, so that each diagonal segment has three tiles, beginning with an upward segment.
Above the green line paint a vertical pair of orange tiles touching each low point of the line (five orange pairs total).
Below the green line, paint blue vertical pairs touching each high point of the green line (four blue pairs total).
In column 3, color the 4th cell purple and the 7th and 10th cells yellow.
In column 9, color the 4th and 10th cells purple and the 7th cell yellow.
In column 15, color the 10th cell purple and the 4th and 7th cells yellow.

For each colored cell, draw two three hex triangles on either side of the cell, so that two hexes of each triangle are touching the color cell in a barbell shape. If the hex is purple the left triangle will be orange and the right triangle blue. If the hex is yellow, the colors are flipped with the right triangle being orange and the left triangle blue.
In the leftmost column, fill the 4th hex from the top with orange.
Fill the two hexes touching the first to the right with orange to form an arrow shape.
Fill the single hex to the right between the two orange ones with purple.
Fill a blue arrow shape pointing the other direction against the purple hex, starting with two blue hexes touching the right edge of the purple hex.
Repeat the same 3-color shape to the right, starting with the 4th hex from the top in the 7th column from the left in orange.
Repeat the same shape a 3rd time, but with the arrow pointing left in blue, the arrow pointing right in orange, and a yellow hex in between. Start in the sixth column from the right.
Repeat the blue/yellow/orange shape 3 times below the first three shapes, starting with the 4th hex from the bottom in the left-most column in blue.
Repeat the shapes 3 more times on the bottom of the grid, with a blue/yellow/orange shape on the left and two orange/purple/blue shapes on the right.

Starting on the left most column, fourth tile down from top, color it orange, then color the two tiles to the right of that tile (centering the first leftmost tile to their left) also color orange, then centered to the right of those two tiles color the tile there purple. Then to the right of that, in a mirror image to the orange tiles color the three there blue.
Repeat the pattern in Step 1, exactly, using the center of the configuration (purple tile again) ninth row from left, fourth tile down.

replicate this pattern twice more, ninth tile from left bottom most tile, purple center hex there, and repeat color tile configuration again. Lastly using the fourth tile from right, leftward, bottom most tile, purple, make the pattern once more.

Make the same shape again but using left three tile color as blue, center tile as yellow and right three tiles as orange. Do this on the fourth tile from right, fourth tile downwards, yellow center is the middle of the shape/design here.

Repeat this pattern exactly, color and design wise but with the following 4 tiles as the center (you'll have 5 copies of this pattern total, exactly when finished).  Third tile from the left, bottom most, and Third tile from left, fourth from bottom, Fourth tile from bottom on ninth column from left., Lastly on fourth from right, (leftward) fourth from bottom. These are all yellow centers for the same shape.
In the ninth column from the left, counting from the bottom, paint the second and third, and sixth and seventh tiles yellow.
Paint all the tiles adjacent to the yellow tiles green.

Working to the left of the green rings, paint a line of three black tiles that go upward diagonally, starting with the tile touching the green ring that is directly to the left of the topmost yellow tile, then adding one more black tile directly above and touching the leftmost tile of that line.

Starting in the tile touching the place directly left of where the two green rings touch, form two diagonal lines of six black tiles extending upwards and downwards from that tile, adding one more black tile immediately down and to the left of the outer end of the upper line, and one immediately up and to the left of outer end of the lower line.

Paint a downward diagonal line of three black tiles, starting with the tile touching the green ring that is directly to the left of the bottom yellow tile, then add one more black tile to the adjacent tile down and to the right of the outer end of that line.
On the right hand side of your figure, create a mirror image of the four black legs that are on the left.

Starting in the tile that touches directly above the topmost green tile, give your bug a purple antenna by painting that tile purple, then forming a V shape by painting the next two tiles diagonally upward on each side purple.
Draw a green "O" shape with the top hex in the 9th column from the left, 3rd hex down. Fill three hexes down on either side. The two hexes enclosed by the green O are filled yellow.
Repeat the green "O" shape with a yellow center, the top hex of the new "O" directly bellow the bottom hex of the previous one.
Draw a "V" shape in purple, the middle hex directly on top of the top hex in the first "O", extending up and out two hexes in both directions.

Draw a < shape in black, starting with the hex between the right edge of the two "O" shapes. Extend out 5 additional hexes in both directions, then fill one hex down-right from the top arm and one hex up-right from the lower arm.
In the 6th column from the right, fill the 2nd and 3rd hexes from the top with black. Then from the lower hex, fill 2 hexes in a lower-left direction to connect with the green.

In the 6th column from the right, fill the bottom-most hex black, then fill two hexes in a up-left direction to connect to green and one hex in a bottom-left direction to touch the bottom of the grid.
Mirror the black "arms" extending on the right side of the green onto the left side of the green shapes.
Create a brightly colored spider with 8 legs here. Start at the thorax. Count from left, 9 columns from left, go downwards from top to tile 4th and 5th, and 8 and 9th from top. color those yellow.
Surround all yellow tiles with green tiles, encasing all sides of yellow tiles with green colored ones.
Atop the highest green tile, create a purple v shaped antennae, using 5 tiles.

From the middle narrowest part of the "waist" of the insect create a pair of legs, which V out from the black tile you will place at that narrow point. From that point, V outward with 5 additional black tiles, forming a uniform V in each side of the insect, this will comprise 4 of the spider's 8 legs.

Now, add one tile to the end of each of these four legs, curving it inward (the topmost legs will have a foot angling downward to create a hook effect. The bottom legs so far will also hook, but upward.)

On Seventh tile in from left, 4th tile down, color that hex tile, black. Using 3 tiles, make a higher leg, adding an additional black tile, straight above the endmost black tile. Mirror that on the other side of the spider's body.

Add the lower pair of legs by coloring black, the second tile from the bottom on the seventh column from the left, adding two more parallel tiles, then mirroring it on the opposite side of the spider's body for symmetry. Add a foot (tile) just inside the last and lowest of the black tiles so far here.
Make sure all parts (each side) mirror the other perfectly and it is symmeterical.
Counting from the top and left, paint the third tile in the third tile in the eighth column, the third tile in the eleventh column, and the fifth tile in the twelfth column yellow.

Form purple, red, and blue flowers by painting the tiles adjacent to the leftmost yellow tile purple, the tiles adjacent to the next yellow tile to the right red, and the tiles adjacent to the last yellow tile blue.

Counting from the bottom tile in the sixth column from the left, paint an ascending diagonal line of ten orange tiles, then paint the all ten of the tiles in that sixth column orange, forming a V shape.
Fill in all the blank spaces inside the V that are between the V and the flowers, using orange.
Paint the top two tiles of the seventh column from the left and the two tiles directly above the rightmost tiles of the V orange.
Using green, paint the remaining blank tiles directly adjacent to the flowers.
Paint the top tile of the ninth column from the left and the third tile from the top of the fifth column from the right green.
Paint the bottom six tiles of the fifth column from the left green.

Starting with the adjacent tile above and to the left of the top of the green line in the previous step, paint the next three tiles green around the blank tile that is adjacent to the left of the top two green tiles of that line.
Beginning in the tile at the bottom of the eighth column from the left, repeat the green shape, formed in the previous two steps, along the lower right edge of the orange area.
On 8th column from left, third tile from top, color that tile yellow, then color all tiles touching it purple.
Third tile from top, 11th column from left, color that tile yellow, then all tiles touching it red.
12 columns over from left and 5th from the top, color that tile yellow and all tiles touching it blue.
Color the sixth column from left orange from top to bottom.
Color orange the fifth tile from top and fourth columned tile from right (going leftward). Now color the tile below that 6th from top, orange.
From that 6th orange tile down 4th column from right complete a diagonal line of orange tiles going to the bottom most orange tile already filled in at this point.
From 8th to 12th top most tiles of columns paint them green. Also color the tile between the purple flower and green tiles, green.
From fifth column from right color the third and fourth tiles down from the top green.
From sixth column from right color the second to fourth tiles down from the top green.
color all the tiles bounded in by the orange tiles and flowers (Purple, Red, and blue), orange.
From seventh column from left color the top most tile and the one below it orange. Also color the tile between the blue flower and the orange and green tiles, orange.

Now create green canes starting adjacently to lowest orange tiles, emanating diagonally on the right and vertically up from the left. Canes are 6 tiles long in each occasion. Then adding a 3 tiled cane shaped top in each case.
Fill circle formed by six purple hexes, the top-most hex in the 2nd hex from the top in the 8th column from the left. Fill the hex in the center of the circle with yellow.
Draw another circle with a yellow center but a red outline, top-most hex in the 2nd hex from the top of the 8th column from the right.
Draw another circle with a yellow center but a blue outline, top-most hex in the 4th hex from the top of the 7th column from the right.
Fill the 6th column from the left entirely with orange.
Fill the 7th column from the left entirely with orange except for the two hexes already colored purple.
In the 8th column from the left, fill the top-most and bottom-most hex green.
Starting with the bottom-most hex in the 8th column from the left, fill 5 more hexes in a straight line toward the top-right corner.
Use the end of the green line just drawn as the top of a six-hex circle, but leave the lower-left hex white (filling 3 more hexes green this step)
In the 6th column from the right, fill the 2nd hex from the top and the two below it with green.
In the 5th column from the right, fill the 3rd and 4th hex from the top green, fill the two hexes below that orange.
In the 4th column from the right, fill the 5th and 6th hexes from the top orange.
Fill the remaining white hexes above the purple and red circle with green.
Fill the remaining white hexes below the purple and red circles with orange.
In the 5th column from the left, fill the 6 lowest hexes green.
Use the top hexes in the line just filled as the right edge of a 6-hex circle shape, but leave the lower-left hex white (filling 3 more hexes green this step)

Starting in the fourth tile from the top of the leftmost column, color six diagonally ascending tiles in a rainbow sequence, which will always cycle through the colors: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple.
Beginning two tiles below the red tile, color six diagonally ascending tiles parallel to the first line, beginning with orange, and cycling through the rainbow sequence to end with red.
Beginning two tiles below the orange tile, color another parallel line of six tiles in rainbow sequence, this time beginning with the next color, yellow, and cycling through to end with orange.
Beginning with the bottom tile of the leftmost column (two tiles below the yellow tile), color a parallel line of six tiles in rainbow sequence, starting with the next color in the series, green.
Beginning at the farthest available left edge each time, color a line of six black tiles beneath each of the rainbow sequences.
Starting with red in the fourth tile from the top of the second column from the right, color an exact mirror image of the previous five steps.

Starting with blue in the bottom tile of the fourth column from the left, color six tiles in a diagonally ascending rainbow sequence ending in green, then reverse the colors in a descending sequence ending with blue in the bottom tile of the fifth column from the right, with the green tile as the center point of the pattern.
Color all seven available tiles that directly touch the figure from the previous step, using black.
Color the center tile of the remaining three blank tiles at the bottom red, and the tiles on either side of the red tile purple.
In the top center of the blank area in the middle of the pattern, paint the top three center tiles green, forming the top half of a ring.
Paint the bottom half (three tiles) of the ring started in the previous step yellow, leaving a blank tile in the center.
Directly below the yellow tiles from the previous step, paint the two tiles directly under the outer two yellow tiles orange.
Paint the two tiles directly below the two orange tiles red.
Paint the tiles directly below the red tiles purple, plus the adjacent tile above and between those two, forming the top half of a ring.
Paint the bottom half of the ring started in the previous step blue, leaving a blank tile in the center of the ring.
Color all three blank center tiles from the previous steps (ten through fifteen) black.

Choose the color black. Fill in the second, fourth, sixth, and ninth hexagon from the top in column 9. Then, color in the diagonal starting from the fifth hexagon from the top in column 1 ending at the second hexagon from the top in column 6. Do the same thing with the right side starting with the fifth hexagon from the top in column 17 and ending at the second hexagon from the top in column 12. As you can see, they are mirrors of each other. Then, skipping a row underneath, fill in the same pattern, and then do that again a second time on both sides, and then a third, where the fourth diagonal of black hexagons is slightly protruding more than the other diagonals, but they still have the same number of hexagons. Finally, fill in the bottom left and right diagonals, starting with the bottom-most black hexagon in column 9 and ending at the bottom-most empty hexagons in columns 6 and 12.

By now, it should be clear that we are creating a mirror image. We are going to fill in each diagonal using the acronym ROYGBP, where each letter is a color that can be used. Directly above the first black diagonal on each side, use ROYGBP and repeat a similar procedure as in the black color step. For instance, a red hexagon should be filled above the first black hexagon that was filled in column 1 and 17. Then, using ROYGBP, the next one in the diagonal should be orange, and so forth. Then, skipping over the first black diagonal like in the first step you will now use OYGBPR on both sides. You can see that the pattern is a different color starts. So skipping the second diagonal, YGBPRO should be the next pattern, then skipping the third black diagonal on both sides, the diagonal should GBPROY. Finally skipping the fourth diagonal, the order should BPROYG, where both diagonals share the green hexagon.
Using the color green, fill in the first hexagon from the top in columns 8,9,10.
Using the color yellow, fill in the second hexagons from the top in columns 8 and 10 and the third hexagon from the top in column 9.
Using the color orange, fill in the third hexagon from the top in columns 8 and 10.
Using the color red, fill the fourth hexagon from the top in columns 8 and 10. Then, fill in the bottom-most hexagon in column 9
Using the color purple, fill in the fifth and bottom-most hexagons in columns 8 and 10. Then, fill in only the fifth hexagon from the top in column 9.
Finally, using the color blue, fill in the sixth hexagon from the top in columns 8 and 10. Then, fill in the seventh hexagon from the top in column 9.
Starting at the bottom of the leftmost column, color the first cell green, then skipping rows between each color the 3rd, 5th and 7th cells yellow, orange and red respectively

Starting from each of these cells color the following pattern in lines going diagonally up and to the right for 6 cells. The pattern should always be: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple and then repeat starting with red again.
Between each of these lines color lines of 6 cells black, creating 3 lines of black
Starting at the bottom of the second cell, draw a 6 cell diagonal black line, directly below the first line drawn
Below this, draw a colored 6 cell line starting at the bottom of the third column from the left, repeating the pattern from step 2 with blue as the first cell.

Repeat steps 1-5, but mirrored starting in the second column from the right. The pattern is the same but all the lines will go diagonally up and to the left. The two figures will meet in the 9th column from the left, sharing a green cell there.
Below this joined figure draw a black angle, so that it is directly below the two lowest colored lines, with its point below the center green hex
Below this line color the three cells purple, red and purple going from left to right
In the 8th and 10th columns from the left color the top 6 cells in each column with the pattern from step 2 reversed: green, yellow, orange, red, purple, blue
At the top of the 9th column color the top cell green, and then skipping every other cell, color the following: yellow, purple and blue. Which will touch the green cell from step 6
In column 9 color any remaining blank cells black
In the first three columns from the left and the second, third and fourth columns from the right, paint the bottom tile and the second tile from the top black.
Using green, paint the top two tiles of the ninth column from the left, plus the tile at the top of the adjacent column to the right and left of that one.
With orange, paint the five adjacent tiles below the green tiles.
Still using orange, paint the seven adjacent tiles below the orange tiles from the previous step.
Paint the nine adjacent tiles below the ones painted in the previous step using the following colors, starting from either right or left: one orange, three black, one orange, three black, one orange.
In the next adjacent tiles below, starting from right or left, paint: one orange, one black, one yellow, five orange, one yellow, one black, one orange.
In the next eleven adjacent tiles below, make the center tile and the second tile from each edge black, and all the others orange.
Directly below the center black tile from the previous step, paint the next tile, plus the ones to its lower right and left yellow, to form a group of three yellow tiles.
Paint all remaining adjacent blank tiles around the three yellow tiles black.
Paint all remaining blank tiles that are adjacent to the black ones from the previous step orange.
