On Third column from left, fourth tile town, and then ninth row from left and 8th tile down, and fourth row from right going leftwards, fourth tile down, color those orange and then color all tiles touching the orange tile purple. This will create a sort of flower look.

On Third row from left, third tile from bottom, on ninth row from left, 4th tile down and 4th row from rightmost tile going leftward and third tile upward, color them yellow. Color all tiles touching the yellow tiles blue.
Fill the first column on the left with alternating green and yellow hexes, green first, ending with yellow on bottom.
Fill right-most column with alternating yellow and green hexes, yellow first, ending with green on bottom.
Fill the 6th column from left the with alternating red and orange hexes, red on top, orange on bottom.
Fill the 7th column from the right with alternating orange and red hexes, orange on top, red on bottom.
Fill all white hexes on the very top and bottom of each column with green.
Fill a six-hex circle in purple, surrounding a single hex filled orange. Top top of the circle is in the 3rd column from the left, 3rd hex from the top.
Create an identical purple circle with orange centered between the two multi-colored lines on the right side of the grid, same height as the first circle.
At the same height between the two middle lines, create a horizontally centered blue circle around a yellow hex.
Create another purple circle around orange in the middle of the grid, horizontally aligned with the last circle but with the bottom-most hex of the circle touching a green hex on the bottom
Create two blue circles with a yellow center, aligned vertically with the last circle and vertically aligned with the first two purple circles.

Starting in the 6th cell from the top of the left column, color a diagonal row of cells red, going up to the top row, and then back down to the 5th cell of the right column. A red chevron will be drawn.
Repeat step one directly below the red chevron five more times, in order drawing chevrons of orange, yellow, green, blue and purple. The last chevron will start in the second column.
In the 2nd cell of the third column color this hex yellow.
Surround the hex drawn in Step 3 with 6 more yellow cells, creating a yellow circle.
Paint hexagon one in column ten red as well as hexagon six in column one and hexagon five in the last column and all of the hexagons between to make two diagonal red lines of hexagons.
Paint all of the hexagons touching the bottom of the red lines orange and the ones below the orange lines yellow.
Paint all of the hexagons touching the bottom side of the yellow line green and those below the green line blue, ending by painting all of the hexagons touching the bottom of the blue lines purple.
Paint the second hexagon in the third column yellow and all of the hexagons surrounding it yellow as well.
With red, paint the top cell of the 10th column from the left.
Starting with the cell in step 1, continue a descending line to the left to the edge with red.
Starting with the cell in step 1, continue a descending line to the right to the edge with red.
With orange, fill in one row of cells directly underneath each of the red cells from steps 1-3.
With yellow, fill in one row of cells directly underneath each of the orange cells from step 4.
With green, fill in one row of cells directly underneath each of the yellow cells from step 5.
With blue, fill in one row of cells directly underneath each of the green cells from step 6.
With purple, fill in one row of cells directly underneath each of the blue cells from step 7.
With yellow color the cell at the 2nd cell from the top in the 3rd column from the left.
With yellow, color each of the 6 surrounding cells around the cell from step 9.
Fill in all but the last spots with purple in columns 3 and 17.
Fill in the top and next to last spots of the 5th, 7th, 9th, 11th, 13, and 15th columns with purple.
Use red to fill the 3rd-7th spots in the 5th and 15th columns, and the 3rd and 7th spots in the 7th, 9th, 11th, and 13th columns.
Fill the 4th spots in the 6th-14th columns with blue.
Use orange to fill the 6th spots in the 6th-14th columns.
Color purple the row of tiles, third from the left, leaving the bottom most tile here, blank.
Color purple the second row from the right (leftward), except bottom most tile there, leave it blank.
On the topmost tile of the odd rows from left to right starting at the 5th row (columnar) from left color that top tile purple. (until the end - though the next to last column here is already purple.
Color the 9th tile down from each purple tile colored in step 3, color that purple too.
Color red, second tile down from all the top purple tiles. Also color red the seventh tile from the top in each of these rows.
Color orange the fifth tile from bottom to color in red, the nine centered tiles between the purple long columns.
On 4th row from rightmost column (leftward), color red the third through 7th tiles down from top.
On fifth row from left (Columnar) color red the third through 7th tiles from top.
Starting at the sixth tile from the left, color blue all 4th from topmost tiles from that 6th tile rightward until the rightmost red column of tiles.

Using purple, paint all but the bottom tile of column two from the right and column three from the left, then paint every available tile in a direct horizontal line across the grid from the top and bottom purple painted tiles of those two columns.

Working toward the center from the purple columns, skip one column and paint the next column red, leaving a blank tile between the red column and purple tile above and below it, then paint every available tile in a direct horizontal line across the grid between the top and bottom red tile of those red columns red, as well.
Using orange, paint all the adjacent blank tiles directly above the lower horizontal line of red tiles.
Leaving one tile thickness blank above the orange row of tiles, paint a blue line parallel to the orange one.
Fill the second spot with yellow and the last spot with red in the odd-numbered columns.
Fill the 1st spot with orange and the next to last spot with blue in the even-numbered columns.
Create oblong circles by filling the 3rd-7th spots in the 2nd, 4th, 10th, and 12th columns with purple, the close the tops and bottoms on columns 3 and 11.
Use green to make two more oblong circles to the right of the purple ones, leaving a white space between so they don't touch.

Working with purple, counting from the top left, paint the adjacent tiles surrounding the tiles four through seven (leaving those four tiles blank) of columns three and eleven, then do the same with green around the tiles in the same position in columns seven and fifteen.
Again counting from the left, paint the top tile of each even numbered column orange and the second from the bottom tile of each even numbered column blue.
Still counting from the left, paint the second tile from the top of each odd numbered column yellow, and the bottom tile of each odd numbered column red.
Color the top most tile of all even numbered columns orange in color.
Color the second tile from the top of all odd numbered columns yellow.
Color the bottom most tiles of each odd numbered columns red.
Color the second tile up from the bottom of each even numbered column, Blue.

On Third column from the left on fourth through seventh tiles from the top, leave those blank but every tile touching any of these, color them purple.  Do the same for the Fourth through seventh tiles from top on the 11th column from left, do the same there as on the third column, paint purple all tiles that touch these.
On Seventh column from left, tiles four to seven down from top, leave them blank. Color all tiles touching these tiles, green in color.
On Tiles four to seven down on the 15th row from the left, leave them blank, similarly to step 6, coloring all tiles touching them green.
Counting from the top left, using yellow, paint tiles three through eight of the ninth column.

Paint the adjacent tile above and below the yellow line purple. Continuing to use purple, in the third column from the left and the fourth column from the right, paint tiles five and six (counting from either top or bottom), then form a purple diamond by painting lines connecting those purple tiles to the original two tiles.
Working symmetrically from the bottom, paint the line of blank tiles inside and directly above the purple tiles orange.
With black, paint the tiles adjacent to the orange line black (four tiles on either side of the yellow column).
Continuing in the same manner, paint the next line green, three each on the right and left, above the black line.
Continuing up, paint the next adjacent tiles red, two each on the right and left.
Paint the remaining two blank tiles above the red tiles blue.
Use purple to fill the 2nd and 9th spots in the 9th column, and create diagonal lines going to the 5th and 6th spots on the 3rd and 15th columns.
Make a yellow line down the middle of the purple shape.
Use blue to fill the two spots next to the yellow line at the top.
fill in the next diagonal lines with red, the next with green, the next with black, and the last with orange.
On Ninth column from left, second tile down, color that tile purple. On that same column, also color in the second tile from the bottom, purple.
On Third column from left, fifth tile down, color it purple. Connect with the top most purple dot (from step 1), creating a line of purple tiles.
On third column from left, 6th tile from top, color it purple, then connect with that tile, the lowest purple tile colored in step 1.

Create a mirror image of the purple tiles so far colored, using fourth row from right, going leftward and the fifth tile from top and sixth tile from top as the rightmost part of the image. Connect them with purple tiles.
Between highest and lowest tiles colored so far, connect them on that center row with yellow tiles.
The top 2 empty tiles of this figure should be colored blue.
Color the two tiles below each of the blue tiles red.
Color the three tiles diagonally emanating from the red ones, green.
now below the green tiles, color those 4 tiles on each side black.
Complete the other 10 tiles at the bottom that are uncolored inside this figure, orange.
Use green to fill all the spots in columns 6, 12, and 18.
Use orange to make diagonal lines going down to the green lines from spot 2 in columns 1 and 13, and spot 8 in column 7.
Continue with orange to create X's by making diagonal lines going up to the green lines from spot 4 in columns 1 and 13, and the last spot in column 7.
Create blue X's to the left and right of the orange X's leaving the green lines in tact.
Make red X's in the middle of the orange and blue X's creating a center row.
Counting from the right, color columns one, seven, and thirteen green.
Form an orange X connecting the two green columns on the right, centered on the third tile from the top of column four, counting from the right.
Beginning adjacent to and below the orange X, paint a red X in the same way, with a blue X below it.
In the next area to the left, between green columns, paint a stack of Xs in the pattern used in step two, but with the color sequence blue, red, orange, starting from the top.
In the space to the left of the leftmost green column, repeat the pattern of Xs, in the color sequence orange, red, blue, starting from the top.
Fill the 6th and 12th column from the left with green.
Fill the right-most column with green.
Fill a line of 5 orange hexes, starting in the left-most column with the 2nd hex from the top, filling in a down-right direction.
Fill a line of orange hexes starting in the left-most column with the 4th hex from the top, filling in a top-right direction to form an X shape.
Repeat the X shape twice directly below the orange X, top of the next X touching the bottom of the previous. The middle X in red, the bottom X in blue.
Repeat the 3 'X' pattern in the middle of the grid between the green lines, top X in blue, middle X in red, bottom X in orange.
Repeat the 3 'X' pattern in the right side between the last set of green lines, top X in orange, middle X in red, bottom X in blue.
Fill the first and last spots in the odd numbered columns with orange.
Fill in 3 spots down and 3 spots up from each orange spot with yellow.
Paint the first and last hexagons in columns one, three, five, seven, nine, eleven, thirteen, fifteen, and seventeen orange.
Paint the first three hexagons below each of the first orange hexagons in each column as well as the three above each of the last orange hexagons in the last position of each column all yellow.
Color the topmost tiles and the bottom most tiles in all odd numbered columns all the way from left to right.
Add three yellow tiles in the column directly above each orange tile from bottom up.
Add three yellow tiles below each of the top most orange tiles.
Color every topmost tile red (every odd numbered row's upper tile).
Every even numbered row from left all across, color the entire row purple (top to bottom), then the next even numbered row, color it green (top to bottom), continuing to alternate.
Color the bottom most tiles of all odd numbered rows blue.
The fifth and 6th tiles from the top of each column should be colored orange. This will include all the odd tiles, the 5th and 6th of the evens are already purple.
Paint all of the hexagons in columns two, six, ten, fourteen, and eighteen purple.
Paint all of the hexagons in columns four, eight, twelve, and sixteen green.
Paint the last hexagon in columns one, three, five, seven, nine, eleven, thirteen, fifteen, and seventeen blue and the first hexagon in the same columns red.
Paint the fifth and sixth hexagons in columns one, three, five, seven, nine, eleven, thirteen, fifteen, and seventeen orange.
Use purple to fill in columns 2, 6, 10, 14, and 18.
Use green to fill in columns 4, 8, 12, and 16.
Make the first spot in the odd-numbered columns red.
Make the last spot in the odd-numbered columns blue.
Use orange to fill the 5th and 6th spots of the odd-numbered columns.
Paint the first two hexagons of the first two columns green.
Paint the second and third hexagons in the third and fourth columns blue.
Paint the third and fourth hexagons in the fifth and sixth columns orange.
Continue this pattern to form a diagonal line ending with the last two hexagons in the last two columns on the right being painted orange.
Paint the first hexagon in column four black as well as the fourth hexagon in column three.
Paint the second hexagon in the sixth column black as well as the fifth hexagon in column five.
Continue painting hexagons black in the same pattern, ending with the seventh hexagon in column sixteen and the last hexagon in column fifteen.
Starting in the top left cell, color a line going diagonally down to the right with the pattern of two green, two blue and two orange repeating.
In the row below this diagonal line, repeat step 1, creating two lines of the green, blue, orange repeating pattern.
Above the second instance of each color, color a single cell black, skipping the cell in the last column.
Below the first cell of each color, color a single cell black, skipping the first column and starting in the third column.

Starting at the top left most corner going down diagonally there and to the right, create pairs of tiles horizontally all the way to the right bottom of the grid, the lowest two tiles in the right most row, The coloring will be 2 green pairs of tiles (a grid of 4 tiles, this pattern will repeat, to connect to bottom most right 2 tiles in pairs), the colors will be Green, blue, then orange, these three colored patterns will repeat twice, giving you three three colored segments, making a total horizontal line (double line).

Starting on the second colored set of 4 tiles a black tile should be placed, centered above and below each colored set. The bottom most grouping of 4 orange tiles and the upper most grouping of green tiles will not have a black tile centered there.
Paint the fourth and eighth hexagons in column two blue.
Paint the fourth hexagon in column six red and the eighth hexagon in the same column orange.
Paint the fourth hexagon in the tenth column yellow and the eighth hexagon in the same column black.
Paint the fourth hexagon in column fourteen black and the eighth in the same column white.
Paint the hexagons surrounding the blue hexagon in the fourth position of column two green and the hexagons surrounding the blue hexagon below it in the same column black.
Paint the hexagons surrounding the red hexagon blue as well as the the hexagons surrounding the single orange hexagon.
Paint the hexagons surrounding the yellow hexagon red and the ones surrounding the black below it in the same column orange.
Paint the hexagons surrounding the black hexagon yellow and the white hexagon below it black.
On second row from left, 4th from top, color that tile blue, now color all tiles touching that green.
On second column from left, 8th from the top, color that tile blue, now color all tiles touching that black.
On 6th row from left. 4th from top, color it red, then color all tiles touching that one blue.
On 6th row from left, 8th from top, color it orange, then color all tiles touching that one blue.
on 10th row from left, 4th tile from top color it yellow, then color all tiles touching it red.
Repeat pattern, 10th left, 8th top black then orange (similar to previous steps).
14th from left, repeat downward 4th tile, black, yellow all touching, similarly.
14th from left leave blank (8th from top), but color black all touching,
Make a green flower by filling in the 4th and 5th dots of columns 1 and 3, and the 3rd and 5th dots of column 4.
Use black to make a flower under that in spots 8 and 9.
fill those middles with blue.
Make two blue flowers in line with the green and black flowers on columns 5-7.
Fill the middle of the top one with red, and the bottom with orange.
Create a red flower with a yellow center in line with the green flower on columns 9-11, and an orange one with a black center in line with the black flower.
Use yellow to make a flower in line with the red on in columns 13-15, and fill it with black.
Make a final flower under that in line with the orange flower using black and leaving the middle white.
Paint the third hexagon in the first column green as well as the first hexagon in column five and then paint the hexagons between those two to form a diagonal line.
Paint the second hexagon in column eight green and then paint the hexagons between that hexagon and the first hexagon in column five to make a diagonal line.
Paint the first hexagon in column eleven green as well as the hexagons between that one and the second hexagon in column eight to form another diagonal line.
Starting with third hexagon in the second column, paint hexagons orange to copy the pattern of the green line above, ending with the first hexagon in the fifteen.
Starting with the fourth hexagon in the third column, paint hexagons yellow to copy the orange line above, ending with an yellow hexagon in the first position of column eighteen.
Starting with the fourth hexagon in the fourth column, paint hexagons red to copy the pattern of the yellow line above, ending with the third hexagon in the last column on the right.
Paint the fifth hexagon in the fifth column blue and the eighth hexagon in column eleven as well as the hexagons between to form a diagonal line.

Paint the fifth hexagon in the column farthest to the right blue as well as all of the hexagons between that one and the eighth hexagon in column eleven to finish the diagonal line and copy the pattern from the lines above.

With green, starting in the third tile from the top of the column to the far left, paint an ascending diagonal line of five tiles to the top of the grid, then diagonally down for three tiles and up again for three more, ending with the top tile of column eleven, counting from the left.

Beginning in the third tile from the top of the next column to the right, paint with orange up along the underside of the green line for four tiles, down for four more, then diagonally up for six more tiles to the top of the grid, leaving a blank line that is one tile thick between the last segment of the two lines.

Moving to the next column to the right, paint yellow along the underside of the orange line for seven tiles, then continue diagonally down for one more tile before turning up to parallel the yellow, but with one blank tile thickness between the last segments, as in the previous step.

Moving to the next column to the right, paint with red along the underside of the yellow line (seven tiles), then extend the red line for one more tile, before turning diagonally up, parallel to the yellow line, with one blank tile thickness between the rightmost segments.

Starting in the next column to the right, paint with blue along the underside of the red line for seven tiles, plus one more, then diagonally up for six more, leaving a one tile thick blank line between the last segment of blue and red.
In the 5th column, color the top 5 cells the following colors in order: green, orange, yellow, red and blue

To the left, draw lines going diagonally down from each colored cell. The green line should extend for 5 cells to the edge of the board, and each line below it should be one line shorter. So for the final line, there should still be one single blue cell

To the right, draw lines going diagonally down again from each colored cell. The green line should be extended by three cells and this time each row below it should be extended by one. So the orange line will be extended by 4 until the blue line is extended by 7

From the end of each of the lines drawn in step 3, the lines should be drawn in the same color diagonally up and to the right until they reach the edge of the board. This way they all reverse direction with a blank row of cells between each line drawn in this step
Paint the second hexagons on columns one, three, five, seven, nine, eleven, thirteen, fifteen, and seventeen, orange.
Paint the third hexagons in columns two, four, six, eight, ten, twelve, fourteen, and sixteen red.

Continuing this pattern, making each line one shorter by one on the left and right sides, make the next lines green, blue, and purple, with the last line being yellow and starting with the second to last hexagon in the sixth column and ending with the second to last hexagon in column twelve.
In the left-most column, fill the 2nd hex from the top orange.
In every other column, fill the hex at the same height orange (8 more orange hexes)
In the second column from the left, fill the 3rd hex from the top red.
In every other column, fill the hex at the same height red except the one furthest to the left (7 more orange hexes)
Fill 7 green hexes in similar fashion, every other column at the same height, starting with the 5th hex from the top in the 3rd column from the left.
Fill 6 blue hexes continuing the upside down pyramid pattern, starting with 4th column from the left, 6th hex down.
Continue the upside down pyramid filling 5 hexes purple, every other column starting with the 3rd hex from the bottom in the 5th column from the left.
Finish the upside down pyramid with 4 yellow hexes spaced similarly.
Starting on the left, paint the second tile from the top of each odd numbered column orange.
Using red, paint the third tiles from the top of the even numbered columns that are between the orange tiles from the previous step.
Using green, paint the fifth tile from the top of odd numbered rows that are between the red tiles from step two.
Continue working downwards, maintaining the same pattern and spacing established in the previous steps, using blue, then purple, then ending with yellow.
Paint the fifth hexagon on column six black as well as the fifth hexagon in column fourteen.
Paint the fifth and sixth hexagons in columns three, nine, eleven, and seventeen all black.
Paint all of the hexagons touching the black hexagon in column six green and all of the hexagons touching the black hexagon in column fourteen blue.
Add a circle of blue hexagons around the green hexagons in the same manner as well as a circle of purple hexagons around the blue hexagons.
Paint the fifth hexagon in column ten red.

Paint the third hexagon in columns five and seven purple as well as the second hexagon in column six and then repeat the pattern on the bottom of the blue circle of hexagons, painting the eighth hexagons in the same rows purple as well.
Paint three hexagons green on the top and bottom of the purple circle of hexagons, copying the pattern of the previous purple hexagons on the top and bottom of the blue circle of hexagons.
In the 6th and 14th columns from the left, color the 5th cell from the top black.
Surround each of these cells with a ring of colored hexes, green on the left and blue on the right.
Around these small rings color a larger ring for each, in blue on the left and purple on the right.
In the top and bottom three cells touching each large ring, color them purple on the left and green on the right.
In the two cells touching the left and right edges of each large ring, color them black.
Between the two figure color a single cell red so that it joins the left and right figures by touching two black cells from each side.
On 6th row from the left, 5th tile from top, color it black. color all tiles touching this black tile, Green. Then color all tiles touching the outer parts of the green tiles, blue.
Color the three tile that are blank above the topmost and the three tiles that are blank below the bottom most, blue tiles, purple.

Color the tiles that are Center of the image and to the left of it black this will be 2 tiles, one below the other, do the same with the right most center of the image, color those, in a mirrored fashion black.
Between the two black tiles to the right most of the image, color it red.

create an exact mirror image to the one made in steps 1, 2, and 3, just to the right of the red hex tile. To check, the center black tile of the right image will be found on the 14th row (vertical row) from left, 5th tile downwards.

The image you are mirroring will have a different scheme of color though, the inner tile is still the one laid in step 5, and is black then touching it will be blue, then outward to purple, then like in step 3 black tile pairs are left to right, but Green tiles, 3 top 3 bottom.
Paint the fifth hexagons in columns six and fourteen black.
Paint the first hexagons in columns five, six, seven, thirteen, fourteen, and fifteen blue.
Paint the first hexagon in column three purple and continue painting hexagons purple moving down to the second hexagon in column six and back up to hexagon one in column nine.
Copy the same pattern of purple hexagons below the blue hexagons to the right, starting with the first hexagon in column eleven and ending with the first in column seventeen.
Paint a row of blue hexagons below the purple, starting with the first hexagon in the second column and ending with the first hexagon in column eighteen.
Paint a row of purple hexagons below the previous row of blue ones, starting with a purple hexagon in the second position of column two and ending with the second hexagon in column eighteen.

Copy the same pattern of purple and blue lines mirrored below the black dots as above, starting with a blue line that begins with the eighth hexagon in column two and ends with the eighth hexagon in the last column on the right.
In the 6th column from the left, fill the top-most hex blue, also fill the hex to the top-right and top-left in blue.
Repeat the 3-hex blue shape centered in the 5th column from the right.
Fill each hex directly below the blue hexes (to left and right) with purple. Extend the purple lines in both directions to form two upside-down V shapes touching the top of the grid.
Fill each hex directly below the purple line (to left and right) with blue.
Fill each hex directly below the lowest blue line with purple (only hexes directly below, not to lower-left and right of each hex)

Mirror the wave pattern with the colors swapped on the bottom of the grid. Start with 3-hex purple shapes centered on the 6th column from the left and 5th column from the right, 2nd hex from the bottom.
Color the hex single between the peaks of both mirrored wave patterns black.
Counting from the right, paint the top tile blue in columns four, five, six, twelve, thirteen, and fourteen.

With purple, paint the adjacent tiles below the blue ones purple, forming a V beneath each group of three blue tiles, then extend the upper ends of the two V shapes for one more tile to the top tile of the columns to the right and left of the V.
Paint all adjacent tiles below the purple ones with blue (extending from the farthest column on the right to the second column from the left).
Switching to purple, paint the adjacent tiles directly below the blue ones from the previous step.
Paint a single black tile directly below and touching the lowest point of the V shapes formed in steps 1 through 4.

Using the opposite colors, form a mirror image of the one above the black tiles (beginning with blue in the row that touches the bottom of the black tiles and ending in two groups of three purple tiles at the bottom).

Color each tile that is second from the top yellow. Below the yellow tiles, color a row, up to downwards, 5 tiles, orange, alternate that with a black row next,(Consisting of 5 tiles) continue this alteration for all rows, including the third tile from top to the 8th tile from the top. Do this to rows from left to right all the way to the end of the rightmost edge of tiles. Along the bottom of the orange and black alternated tiles, color a red row, this will be the third row from the bottom, all the way from left to right.
Fill five hexes in the left-most column with orange, starting with the third hex from the top.
Fill five hexes in the 2nd column from the left with black, starting with the third hex from the top.
Repeat the line pair 8 more times filling the grid horizontally.
Fill a single hex on top of each black and orange line with yellow.
Fill a single hex directly below each black and orange line with red.
Use yellow to fill in the second spot on every column.
Use orange to fill in the 3rd-7th spots on the odd numbered columns.
Use black to fill in the 3rd-7th spots on the even numbered columns.
Use red to fill in the 8th spot on every column.

Color the fifth tile and the eighth tile from the top of the fifth row from the left, black. Color the bottom tile on the ninth row from the left and the third tile down on that (ninth from left) row, black.  Color the fifth and eighth tiles of the thirteenth row from the left black. Now connect all these black hex tiles to make a large Black hex outline. Filling in tiles between these "dots" making an outline of a hexagon.
Color in the inside of all these black tiles to make a yellow Hex shaped outline just inside the black hex.

Just inside the new yellow hex, color in all tiles that touch the hexagon created in step 2 (the yellow tiles here) black except on the ninth row from the left, fifth tile down, color that yellow. Also color the sixth tile from the top on the seventh row from the left yellow. Color yellow instead of black the sixth tile from the top on the 11th row from the left.
In the center of the smiling face created here, color in the 4 blank tiles surrounded by black and yellow tiles here, yellow.
Use black to make a circle by filling the 5th-8th spots of columns 5 and 13, the 3rd and last spot in column 9, and the connecting lines.
Fill the circle with yellow.
make a smiley face using black to fill in spots 5 in the 8th and 10th columns, the 7th spots in columns 7,8,10, and 11, and the 8th spots in column 9.
Counting from the left, in column nine, paint the bottom tile and the third tile from the top black.
Again counting from the left, in column five and column thirteen, working from the bottom, paint tiles three through six black.
Paint lines of black tiles connecting the original two black tiles to the two columns of black tiles, to form a six sided ring.
Paint a ring of yellow tiles directly inside the black ring.
Paint the five tiles directly above and touching the bottom half of the yellow ring black, forming a shallow V shape.
Counting from the left, in columns eight and ten, paint the tile directly below the upper half of the yellow ring black.
Fill in any remaining blank tiles inside the ring with yellow.
Color the three tiles in each of the 4 corners of the grid, red.
Color the center tile purple, this is the sixth tile from the top, on the ninth row from the left.
Color all tiles touching the center purple tile, purple also.

From the two tiles on the right and two tiles on left of the center purple shapes, extending toward each corner, connect toward the center of the red tiled corners, forming 4 black lines. The Black tiles on left will be six in number, the top right line will consist of seven tiles (black), and on the right bottom quadrant, there will be 6 black tiles.
Use red to fill the top and bottom two spots in the first and last columns, and the first and last spots in the next to first and next to last columns.
Purple to fill a flower shape in the 8-10th columns in the 5th and 6th spots.
Use black to create 4 diagonal lines emitting from the petals to the corners.
Counting from the left and bottom, in the ninth column, color the fifth tile and the ring of tiles adjacent to it purple.
In each corner, paint the three corner-most tiles red.
Using black, paint diagonal lines extending as if from the center of the central purple figure to the outer corners, forming an X that connects the figure to the corners.

You will be  making blue and pink flowers. There will be a blank white hexagon in the center with the 6 hexagons surrounding it being colored.
We will do the first flower. Find the second column from the left, and the second hexagon down. This will be the center of the circle that will be kept white.

The 6 surrounding hexagons will be made blue in color. So the first column going down will be white, blue, blue, white. The second column going down will be blue, white, blue. The third column going down will be white, blue, blue, white.

Under this we will do the pink flower. The top pink petal will be directly under the bottom blue petal with no white space in between. The space under this will be the white center hexagon. Fill all 6 surrounding petals in with pink.

We will now do a blue flower under this pink one in the same manner. The top blue petal will be directly under the bottom pink petal, and the hexagon under than will be the center white hexagon with all 6 surrounding hexagons colored blue.
You should now have a column of three flowers colored blue, then pink, then blue.

Create another set of three flowers, stacked vertically just like the first set and at the same level. This second set will have one line of tiles dividing it from the first set. The top flower for this second set will be pink. The middle flower should be blue. Make the bottom flower pink.

Create another two sets of three flowers. Vertically stacked at the same level as the others and each separated from the set to its left by one line of tiles. Each set across should have alternating blue and pink flowers with the third set starting in blue and the rightmost one with pink.

In the 1st column from the left, color the 2nd and 3rd hexagons from  the top blue.

In the 3rd column from the left, color the 2nd and 3rd hexagons from the top blue. You should have a blue "ring" shape - this shape will be our basic pattern.
Make a purple ring directly under the first blue ring, so that the top hexagon of this new ring touches the bottom hexagon of the first ring.
Similar to the last step, add another blue ring directly under the purple ring.

Reflect this pattern of three vertical rings using the 4th column as the line of symmetry (leave all hexagons in this column uncolored), but reverse the colors so that the top and bottom rings are purple while the middle ring is blue.

Reflect this pattern of six rings using the 8th column as the line of symmetry (leave all hexagons in this column uncolored). The rings should alternate between blue and purple in a checkerboard pattern.

Starting from the top left corner, color every other top hexagon per column in the following order (left to right): orange, green, green, green, orange, green, orange, orange, orange. You should have 9 colored hexagons total.
For the columns with an orange top hexagon, color the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th columns from the top purple.
For the columns with a green top hexagon, color the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th columns from the top blue.

Now starting from the bottom RIGHT corner, color the bottom hexagon of every other column in the following order (RIGHT TO LEFT): green, green, orange, orange, orange, green, green, orange, green. Note that these should not be in the same columns where there are already colored hexagons present.
For the columns with an orange bottom hexagon, color the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th columns from the bottom purple.
For the columns with a green bottom hexagon, color the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th columns from the bottom blue.
Note: the only color used in this pattern is ORANGE.
In the 3rd column from the left, fill in the 3rd hexagon from the top and the 2nd hexagon from the bottom.
In the 4th column from the RIGHT, fill in the 3rd hexagon from the top and the 2nd hexagon from the bottom.
Taking these four hexagons as the corners of a rectangle, fill in the two diagonal lines between them to make a solid "X" shape.
Fill in the 5th hexagon from the top in the 3rd column from the left, and the 3rd hexagon from the top in the 7th column from the left.
Fill in the diagonal between the two hexagons you marked in the previous step, to make a line which intersects the top left arm of the "X".
Now fill in similar intersecting diagonals for the other arms of the "X", making them symmetric horizontally and vertically around the center of the "X".
Start at the top left corner of the board and make a bow shape in purple that has a height of two tiles and width of three tiles.

Moving down diagonally to the right, fill in 4 more orange tiles.
Now move diagonally and to the left, filling in 4 more orange tiles.
Fill in the 3 tiles in the middle of this triangle orange
From the bottom left corner of the board, move over 6 columns and fill this bottom tile orange.
Fill in the 5 tiles above it orange as well.
Recreate the triangle shape so it has 6 orange tiles on each side and is filled in with orange tiles.

Begin with a dog-bone shaped object that consists of two hexagons on either side of a single hexagon. The four outer hexagons are all adjacent to the middle hexagon. This first dogbone object begins in the upper left corner of grid and is purple.

These ‘dog-bone object shapes run vertically down (5 objects in column sequence) and alternate purple and yellow. Each successive dogbone is adjacent to the one above it except for an interstitial hexagon.
The interstitial hexagons are all white.

Next to this first dog-bone object in upper left corner is an object with two hexagons that are vertically related and adjacent. On either side of these two hexagons is a hexagon that fits into the left and right side of these two vertical hexagons but are not contiguous. The object resembles a flower shape.

This first flower shaped object is adjacent to the right side of the dog bone shape in the upper left corner. This first ‘flower’ object is yellow, and the shape is repeated (5 total in the column), but alternates yellow and purple so that a purple and yellow object are never contiguous with dogbones to left of it.
This first ‘flower’ column continues to the bottom of the grid. Each ‘flower’ shaped object is adjacent to the one above it and/or below it.
Continue the above described pattern two more times to complete the grid on the page.

At the end, there should be three columns of dogbone objects alternating with three columns of flower objects. Make sure all interstitial hexagons are white. No purple object is ever contiguous with another purple object, and likewise, no yellow object is ever contiguous with another yellow object.

There are 5 triangles turned on their side in this picture.  They are turned on their side facing the right, as one would find with an arrow. All of these triangles are monochrome orange.

Draw a triangle filling the three top-left-most hexes in orange.

Draw a similar solid triangle but with four hexes on a side, starting with the top 4 hexes of the 9th column from the left. Filling three hexes on the column to the right, then two in the next column, then one in the 4th column.
